Reviews.Title: “THE Place to stay if you have kids...”
Reviews.Author: AMFDB
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the fantastic reviews it received here on TripAdvisor. I booked it online. I was having trouble finding an affordable hotel that could fit a family of five. Imagine my surprise when I found their family suite. One king bed, one double bed and a sofa bed. Plus a full kitchen, dining room, living room and bathroom. The floor plans on the hotel site were exactly how our room looked. We checked in on a Sunday evening and everyone was so helpful until we checked out on Tuesday. The free breakfast on the second floor was delicious. The 24-hour valet parking was convenient. I did some laundry on their 12th floor and was pleased to find out that they sold detergent and softener. Having the kitchen was a great thing, since my husband and I have three kids (5, 10 and 13). We went to the IGA supermarket down the street and stocked up on things to eat at night. My kids loved the rooftop indoor pool and their gym was great. Our suite was spacious, very quiet. If you need to spread out, you should book the Family Suite. The location is great, it is down the street from the Underground City mall and from the Bay Dept. store. The wifi was available and it was free! Did I mention that everyone at Le Square was so helpful??? Harvey, Sebastien, Elena, Louis-Phillip, and Dale were helpful!! After we left, we realized our oldest son left his computer charger plugged in the wall. Willaine in housekeeping mailed it to our home! That is amazing service! We can't wait to go back to Montreal and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: r_h_Toronto
Reviews.Content: If you're traveling as a family, then look no further. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The location is terrific - just off of St. Catherine Street (the main shopping area). The reception is friendly and helpful. The rooms are fresh, airy, and spotless. I'm not sure about other room layouts, but as a group of 4 adults and 3 kids, we took the 2-bedroom suite and were blown away by the amount of space! The living room is huge, and there's a dining table for 6, as well as a kitchen - and the ceilings were 12-13 feet high (ceiling height may not be a critical feature, but it added so much beauty and comfort to the room). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, particularly if traveling with kids. There is plenty of room for kids to move around and play, and the rooms are priced very reasonably. Another perk that's available (but we didn't use) is that you can fill out a grocery list the night before, provide it to the hotel, and they'll deliver the things to your suite, which is very convenient if you do not want to waste time in supermarkets. Breakfast was included with our stay, but it was pretty basic. Bread, bagels, spreads, cereal, muffins, oatmeal, fruits, and beverages. Nothing fancy, but decent nonetheless. A very pleasant stay overall, and we'll definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkT
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel was extremely clean, and the staff was very friendly. The continental breakfast was nothing fancy, but pleasant. The hotel is convenient to everything in Downtown and Old Montreal (and even Mont Royal Park if you don't mind the steep walk), and not far from the Metro if you want to go further. The kids loved the big room and high ceilings. Pool was nice, but the pool area needs more chairs. Fitness room was well-appointed and had a nice view. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Verry Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Razasa
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent The room is huge. The staff is polite and smiling. The pool and the gym are in a lovely terrace. The restaurant is very good. The breakfast is basic. Would recommend to all people.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: McGillparent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a four-day weekend. I didn't really need the full kitchen, but the price here was better than other hotels in downtown Montreal.The rooms were very quiet. One night I noticed a group of young people down the hall and was worried about a loud party, but I heard nothing! The breakfast was just okay, but convenient. The breakfast room is quite large, and you also have the option of filling a tray and eating in your room. Front desk staff were polite and friendly. I didn't find the concierge particularly helpful; I ended up calling for taxis myself. Overall a very comfortable, pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for long stay and families”
Reviews.Author: Marie-Christine P
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a few nights during a short business trip to my hometown. We had chosen it because of its proximity with the office, it had a kitchenette and because of the price. We were very pleased with the hotel, it is very quiet, the rooms are large, clean and well maintained. The decoration is neutral, even a bit plain, clearly designed to last a long time. The kitchenette was well equipped. The hotel offers free wifi in the room (we did not use it), a gym and a pool. They also offer to do your grocery shopping, on request. Breakfast is good, but don't look for eggs or meat. A special mention to the staff who attended during breakfast time, they were all very nice, efficient and friendly! Service in general was fine and polite, but we arrived with a lot of luggages and had to ask for help to the baggage handlers who were...looking at us from inside the hotel. The hotel is well located, very central, with a metro station close by. If you're looking to be nearer bars and clubs, I would suggest you go in the old town or nearer Crescent street. If you're in town for a longer stay, it is a very good option.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Shailender1969
Reviews.Content: I stayed for six weeks in this hotel. My suite was huge with a beautiful kitchen. The location was good on the most happening St. Catherine. Lot of food joints all at walking distance. The breakfast is not all that good but not bad either. The staff is very professional and always ready to help you. The pool and gym are small and very basic but served my purpose. Will come back again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location and the price”
Reviews.Author: Mirweer
Reviews.Content: My hubby and 2 kids (12 and 10) stayed here to explore downtown Montreal. The room was super-spacious and had a full kitchen, which came in handy when we didn't feel up to going to a restaurant. Due to the great location near everything, we ran out and picked up takeout and returned to watch a movie and eat in. The pool was pretty tiny but then, we didn't really come here to swim in the pool. The staff were superb- clearly they know a thing or two about service. Breakfast was a tad heavy on the carbs but sufficient to get us out the door. We were a walk to virtually everything. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: lovehotbeaches
Reviews.Content: So convenient for all things downtown. The hotel suites are well decorated and well maintained. The kitchenette made our stay easier as we had our 7 yr old with us. The beds are very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff and rooms, 9/10”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoFlandBeyond
Reviews.Content: We flew in for three nights and took the cab from the airport to the hotel, ($40.) flat rate. Check in was easy, and the room was large, clean and new. Temperature control was good, and window coverings did their job. The continental breakfast was included in our weekend special( sweet or was it suite deal) as it was listed in the hotels website. The room had full kitchen, and being a converter building thick walls. We would definitely stay here again, the flat screen tv had an external box that allowed you to input your computer into the tv. Internet was free and gave the choice of wired or wireless. Catherine street is one block away, parking is best done by valet, as the lot next door closes at night and they tow everyone away. Yes there is a nice roof top pool. All and all a winner except for the hotels poor signage in the street, perhaps a zoning thing?

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MiltonResident
Reviews.Content: We initially planned to stay here for 2 nights, ended up staying one more night â€“ total 3 nights stay. We got a Suite with kitchenette which was great as our son was 2.5 yr old. We could use the kitchenette for preaparing emergency/ quick meal. Excellent room service and morning breakfast. Location is great. You can actually walk up to the Old Montreal neighbourhood. We parked our car in the hotel parking lot and walked around the old montreal with stroller. I'll definitely consider the place to stay again. Highly recommended for family with kids.

Reviews.Title: “With a fitness room update, it would be perfect”
Reviews.Author: wonworld
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms, generous continental breakfast, pleasant reception and concierge, easy valet parking. The only thing keeping this from feeling perfect is that the fitness equipment needs maintenance or replacement, which I hope is imminent. They donate their used soap and shampoo to a local shelter, which is wonderful. In terms of service, we were awoken by unruly guests and called to alert the front desk. The next day they offered to upgrade us to a family suite (talk about spacious!!) and even left us a nice note and box of awesome chocolates. We have had consistently good experiences here.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: VisitorsToNiagara
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly. Room was extremely clean. Parking was expensive $22/night. Breakfast was simple but everything was very fresh and delicious. Also, we highly recommend the pizza place at the corner with the wood burning oven.

Reviews.Title: “The only choice for a weekend in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: bytowndude
Reviews.Content: I've stayed all over Montreal and there really isn't anything that compares. This place is a former factory/warehouse and as such the rooms are GENEROUSLY large, well appointed. My fifth stay. Huge bright rooms, friendly staff, free wifi, kitchen with all the mod cons (don't forget to check to make sure the fridge is turned on when you get in), a little enclosed warm lap pool/gym on the roof with a glass panorama of the area (you can't open the doors to walk along the balcony on the rooftop in the winter...in the summer, it's nice to have a swim and open the doors and look down on the bustle). You're right in the centre of it all, 10$-ish cabs to any place you'd like to go, but everything walkable in minutes, plenty of places to eat and shop. No-brainer. There's a 10$/night parking lot next door, that will give you time up until 4am, no matter when you pay, but will extend it up until 8-9am on the weekends..(unlikely you'll be up that early) so try and find parking on the street (Sundays you can leave your car unpaid on the street until 1pm right in front of the hotel). Alternatively, you can park at the hotel....$. Checkout is noon, which is brilliant, you can usually check in early too. Not a party hotel, generally speaking. Frankly if you avoid breakfast you rarely see anyone. The breakfast is "continental" but here that just means breads, cereals, and juices. That said, if you stay in Montreal and are up by 10am for a hotel breakfast, you're doing something wrong! Deals are rare with this hotel. With tax, you're usually looking at around 175CAD/night. Well worth it, even with other hotels like the Delta going for 99/night (before taxes). I'll be staying here again, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip with children.”
Reviews.Author: KMW5693
Reviews.Content: We spent Easter here two years ago with three kids under 9. Great location - close to shopping, restaurants and lots of easy walks and pigeon feeding in Phillips Square. We were two blocks from the Metro so we took a cab from the airport, bought Metro passes and went all over the city by subway (a hit with the kids) and by bus - very easy to navigate. Grocery store was about a ten minute walk and we were able to haul food back easily in backpacks. We had a HUGE corner two bedroom suite with full kitchen, dining area and living room. Windows all around. One bedroom had a king and the other a queen. The pool on the roof was a big hit with the kids and the continental breakfast every morning started the days out well. The staff were all friendly and helpful. I don't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “snowy and cold in montreal”
Reviews.Author: JewelLA
Reviews.Content: Service was this hotel's outstanding quality. Concierge service included going to the pharmacy and nearby restaurant to get me medicine and soup when I got a cold from the extreme weather conditions. They also have a grocery buying service which is helpful in such inclement weather. My only complaint is really nothing they could have effected: the city snowblowers and street clearing services begin around 1 a.m. until 5 a.m. on snowy days, and the noise is so constant and loud (like loud garbage trucks scraping pavement all night!) that my sleep was disturbed on nights when it had snowed that day. Thankfully, out of my 2 week stay, this only occurred most of the first week, but not during the 2nd week. When I inquired at the hotel desk if there were any rooms in the hotel that were protected from this very intrusive noise, they said no. Only other problem during sleep was what felt like a cool breeze blowing over me from the heating system which has a vent over it that is forced to blow air in a certain direction and cannot be adjusted. Had to pile up pillows on my bed to block this uncomfortable cool breeze. To the hotel's credit, because of the very dry inside air, they provided me with an excellent air vaporizer that helped immensely. Pool was closed for maintenance during most of my stay which was unfortunate. Lovely staff, very large suites; definitely recommend this hotel -- probably a much nicer stay in nicer weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Daisy005
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with daughter and her boyfriend in December 2011. These apartments are spacious, well-appointed and clean. We had a two bedroom apartment which had one bathroom and kitchen facilities. The staff were very helpful, friendly and professional. Our flight was delayed and we were late arriving but our warm and comfortable room was waiting for us (outside temp was -10C). The concierge was particularly helpful in suggesting places to visit, to shop, to drink and to eat. Try Upstairs jazz restaurant (just a couple of blocks walk) for good beer, food, and music. The apartments are very close to Vieux Montreal for sightseeing, Catherine's Street for shopping, and the Metro for visiting Mont Royale.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: krisfamily
Reviews.Content: We have been to Montreal and Quebec city last August with our family. Our room had two queen beds and a nice kitchennette! Great location with awesome restaurants, parks and churches around! Notredame Basilica is walkable but a bit far. We loved the service, vallet parking was a bit expensive, but we just paid for it than taking pain with the parking! It would be ideal if the carpets are either changed or given a full-deep-cleaning. That would make the hotel just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: Milligan1973
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the large suite we had at the hotel, with kitchenette. Eating out all the time while on holidays gets a little much, so it was nice to be able to sit down in our hotel and have a bite to eat on our own timetable. The pool was a little small, but the kids loved it. We didn't think we would use the gym facility but we did, and it was nice to have it all in one place. Breakfast was yummy, and altough it was busy, we were always able to find a table.

Reviews.Title: “Twice in a row - excellent”
Reviews.Author: yegdragon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here twice - once with 2 kids! - and both times enjoyed it. Big, clean and bright rooms, great front desk service, good pool and gym and the right location. We consider this 'our spot' in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hamish S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Montreal for five nights, and were very pleased with the hotel. We were upgraded to a suite, which was huge - bigger than our first flat we lived in! It was good to have a little kitchen as well. Breakfast was good - bagels, muffins, cinnamon bread, cereal etc. - self service. The pool was ok but a bit small (why do people put pools on the roof, which limits the size? Put them in the basement!) and there wasn't a steam room or sauna. We'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value mid range hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimmycomms
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights over New Year's Eve. The first thing that impressed us was the size of the room - although we booked a King Studio this was more like an apartment, with around 600sq feet of space, and maybe more. We also valued the fully fitted kitchen and spacious separate bathroom. The service was excellent and the basic complimentary breakfast was appreciated. A great option for any trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Excellent - no other way to say it!”
Reviews.Author: figrn
Reviews.Content: From our initial check-in (waaay early, but bags were held), to the room (HUUUGE! and CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN!), to the morning breakfast lounge (well stocked and well serviced). This place, smack dab in the center of the city... walkable from the train station.... Fantastic boutique hotel! There is also an indoor roof top pool and outdoor deck -- didn't swim, but went up for a look. Also, self-serve laundry facilities too. When in Montreal, this is THE place I would look at first.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Minneapolis24
Reviews.Content: We had a fine experience at this hotel and found it to be fairly standard in its offerings of rooms, layout, breakfast, etc. It's centrally located in Montreal so you can walk to the old part of town and the university area and it is right off the bus line to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TessM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as it was in walking distance from the Palais de Congres - except that there was a hill between :) But the staff were very helpful and as I arrived late I was upgraded to a suite (I may have to try that strategy again!). The suite was HUGE and more space than I knew what to do with but it was good as I ended up having meetings in the living and dining rooms. The only downside to this was the breakfast. Very disappointed. Granted, it was complementary but I felt like I was in a school cafeteria. Right off of St Catherine St and down the street from the Bay store and not too far from McGill. I would stay again but plan for breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for visit to Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: info4
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here and it could not have been more perfect. Room was huge with very high ceilings, king bed, full kitchen with dining table and large bathroom. Staff was friendly and helpful when my room card kept getting demagnetized (keep your room card away from cell phones and magnetized purse clasps). The hotel is steps away from Rue Ste. Catherine, the major shopping street in Montreal and a very short walk to Old Montreal historic area. Parking is costly at hotel - $22 per night plus another 13% for those high Montreal taxes on everything. Room rate seemed cheap until checkout when the taxes are added - ouch. The hotel lobby is not large, but you get everything you need including an attached restaurant, a business center, a pool and fitness center. The decor was extremely tasteful and everything was spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mojo-Ravi
Reviews.Content: Staff was wonderful, room was clean, comfortable and spacious. Internet access included, reasonable workout area and good location. Only criticism, and it is a very minor criticism, is that the breakfast left a bit to be desired, but even that was still satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe300g
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend surprised me with a trip to Montreal for my birthday. She picked the Phillips Square because of its central location and Tripadvisor review. We both were very pleased. The hotel is in the business district but just a short walk from the historic more tourist area. The subway was just 2 blocks from the hotel and was very easy to use to get anywhere in the city. The room he had was huge with a full kitchen. We certainly were going to cook given all the good restaurants in the area but it was nice to have the fridge and microwave. The bathroom was also pretty big and the room was very clean. We asked the concierge for help multiple times. Every time they were helpful and made good recommendations. The hotel has a nice outdoors area by the gym that would be nice in warmer weather. The breakfast room was also very nice, but although we liked the breakfast it was a continental breakfast, no hot food, so we chose to eat breakfast elsewhere. Great hotel for a good price in a prime area. Close to everything, but not right on top of it, which we felt was a positive.

Reviews.Title: “Good night sleep in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Anne-Julie
Reviews.Content: I actually live very close to Montreal, but I had to be somewhere downtown really early and ended up spending the night at the Square phillips for 149 + tax. It's a really nice hotel with a pool and a good continental breakfast included. Wireless internet was free, and they also had computers and printers available. We were actually upgraded to a family suite, funny for a couple spending just one night there. The suite was so big, I can easily imagine a family of 4-5 people in there. The indoor pool on the roof is quiet and nice, and the gym seemed to be quite good too. If you go, be sure to try the restaurant "Soupebol" a couple of buildings towards Sainte-Catherine, it's unexpensive and really yummy. Location : perfect location less than a minute walk to the entrance of the La Baie (from there underground access to Eaton center, Place Montreal Trust, Complexe les Ailes, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Missbecca00
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early November and it was wonderful. Room was immaculate, it was great to have a full kitchen and spacious room with lots of light (and room darkening curtains). Fantastic restaurants, coffee shops, shopping within a minute walk. Must try the pizza place across from the park, less than one block from front door of le square Phillips. Perfect location and valet parking that is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBarb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at here for 3 nights from November 4th to 7th. The room was very spacious. I stayed with a friend, there were two double beds in the room and plenty of space so we didn't feel crowded at all. The breakfast was surprisingly satisfying - your typical continental type, with cereal, muffins, bagels, yogurt - but there was plenty of seating and plenty of food (so we didn't feel like we had to rush down first thing to get a seat and/or food). The location at first glance, seemed a little sketchy (it probably didn't help that we arrived at night). But once we got used to the neighborhood, there were plenty of restaurants and shops around. It is about a 10 minute walk (ish) to Old Montreal. There is a pretty good pizza/pasta restaurant right down the street (that is priced very reasonably). The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was clean. It was handy to have a kitchen. I was happy with the hotel, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: AndreeM
Reviews.Content: Been there at least 7 times and I've never been disappointed. Hotel is clean, very convenientwith the kitchen area. Breakfast is very good (continental) also. Nice gym, pool. Walking distance from shopping area, restaurants, Old Port with nice little street to walk around. You have to try the pizza place just next door, it's delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Big Space with Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: CityFoodTours
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights in early September with our 5 year old. While the space is large, visitors should be aware of several things. In all of the reviews, no one mentioned that the windows don't open and that the place is musty. Also, there is nothing luxurious about this hotel. I'd rather have lower ceilings and a 2nd bathroom and windows that open for fresh air. The towels are typical, standard thin hotel grade; same for the bedding. The bed coverings are polyester...There is nothing charming about the location. While Montreal has many cool and charming neighborhoods, this is a busy and not very attractive neighborhood. Construction on the building across the street started at 7 am and we were awoken by banging during the week! We live in Manhattan, so this is saying a lot. The staff was clueless about everything. From the concierge who directed us to walk down a long, seedy street with our young son to get to a metro stop to the woman behind the front desk who told me to call expedia to get a night's refund when we had booked through hotels. com. This place isn't cheap, so know exactly what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: DocBcalgary
Reviews.Content: Took the 747 airport bus which lands a short walking distance from the hotel. Large rooms with kitchenettes; comfortable beds and fairly quiet. Does attract families with kids but more noise from the hall than adjacent rooms. Minimal street noise. The included breakfast is very nice and welcome. Well located for walking to shops, museums, Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great service for families.”
Reviews.Author: CapitalwithKids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference with two adults and two young kids in a double room. This is our second time staying in this hotel. The rooms are surprinsingly large and feel even larger due to the high/industrial ceilings. The beds are comfortable and everything was clean and tidy when we arrived. Check-in was seemless. The valet/concierge service is a nice bonus and while we didn't use the service, we did notice other guests using this person to make restaurant reservations. The hotel pool is small but warm and a good depth for splashing around (about 4 feet). The breakfast is good for a free buffet with some warm (bagel, toast) offerings, fruit, milk, cereals and yogurt. We appreciated that breakfast can also be taken to one's room. The location of the hotel is perfect for shopping, right down from Ste-Catherine. Overall a good stay for a reasonable price. There was a nice mix of families, couples and singles staying at the hotel--it truly caters to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised and thrilled”
Reviews.Author: onemoreflight
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Montreal at several hotels for many years . This was my first time at SPH and I was delighted with the whole experience. This time I was traveling with two teenagers so we occupied a 2 bedroom suit. It was spacious, very well equipped and spotlessly clean. The staff were super friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Will definitely be here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you are traveling with kids!”
Reviews.Author: mom2philip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SPH while at the 2011 CIM conference. Wouldn't normally use babysitting services at a hotel, but we were stuck. Boy were we glad we did. The sitter was amazing! The kids loved her! Ask for Chantal, if ever you need a sitter while at SPH in Montreal. Hotel itself was really clean, with average decor and amenities. I'd say a 3 to 4 star. Service was also great!

Reviews.Title: “Huge spaces, high ceilings”
Reviews.Author: Maria K
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is pretty charmless, the suites are huge. With an eat-in kitchen with seating for six, we felt we could have hosted a dinner party! TVs in both living room and bedroom. The staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious apartment!”
Reviews.Author: Qwerty2468
Reviews.Content: Plenty of room for a family of four. The room was so big, the beds looked small. Excellent location close to shopping on St Catherine Street and McGill metro station. Breakfast was perfectly adequate, although finding table space was a little tricky.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: debbiem14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 2 nights at this hotel in September. The hotel is in a great location. Our room was large, clean and well equipped...the full kitchen was fabulous. The service was great and free wi-fi offered worked perfectly. The complimentary breakfast was also great and I'd also like to thank the breakfast staff who allowed us to sneak into breakfast 10 minutes early before the breakfast service was to begin, because we had to leave at 7am to catch a bus to Vermont. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous remodel, spacious rooms, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ocanada1973
Reviews.Content: Set in an 'old Montreal' building that has had many uses over the decades, this hotel was a surprise from the start. Tripadvisor reviewers had sung its praises, but our taxi driver wasn't so sure. Our experience, right from the start, was perfection. We were greeted by Phillippe, who was friendly and helpful in every way. Then the concierge, Simon, gave us advice as to where to eat (he suggested Restaurant Julien, a block away - do go there) and brought us to our room. And the room! It had been used commercially, and when they remodeled they reused the best structural elements, including huge windows, double-high ceilings, and arched corners (which they have cleverly and subtly spot-lit). Our room was enormous but still cozy, with everything you would expect and lots of room to move around. Unexpected, however, was the complete kitchen, including range, micro, medium-sized fridge, coffee-maker, electric kettle, and even a dishwasher. And there was a shopping list on the fridge for you to fill out if you wish - if you order before 8 am, they will deliver a good range of groceries to your room. There was a lovely table and four chairs for proper dining, as well. Le Square Phillips Hotel and Suites gives outstanding value for money, is in an excellent location (close to the main shopping areas of Montreal), and offers more than you would ever expect. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: trav2well
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. We used Trip Advisor as a guide and were not disappointed. We were lucky to be upgraded to a very large suite. Rooms were very clean with good quality bed linen. We appreciated the firm bed mattress. Lovely high ceilings and large windows made the suite feel very spacious. The kitchen even had a large dining table. Desk had good lighting and a very comfortable chair. Bathroom adequate although, in a windowless room, had no exhaust fan. I would be reluctant to share this two bedroom suite with another couple unless we were on very friendly terms. Laundry was useful - 24 hour access and a clean room. Continental breakfast provided a good range of items to keep healthy diet minded people happy .

Reviews.Title: “Back again”
Reviews.Author: Philly413
Reviews.Content: We still love this hotel. Friendly staff, and the rooms are quite large, clean and very quiet. Breakfast and internet are included in the price and valet parking is available for $22/day. We stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend and it was lovely and warm, you could take your breakfast up to the rooftop terrace and enjoy the view. It's a couple of minutes walk to St. Catherines St. with all the restaurants and shopping. It's about a ten minute walk to both the orange and green metro lines, a great way to visit the Atwater and Jean Talon markets.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Miniml
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at Le Square Phillips during the Canadian Thanksgiving weekend. Le Square Phillips is perfectly located steps away from St Catherine's St., the main shopping district in Montreal. It's also a short walk to the Center of Arts and Museum of Contemporary art. The hotel staff is always friendly and accommodating, and the rooms are spacious, very clean and very quiet. The valet service was prompt, the concierge was always helpful. The rooftop deck was a perfect spot to enjoy a glass of wine, the sunset and the amazing views of the city. If we ever return to Montreal, Le Square Phillips will be our first choice of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yyyzzz111
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, hotel is centrally located in downtown near many restaurants and shopping, although not really in walking distance from Old Montreal or the more charming parts of town but, quick cab ride away. I had the impression the hotel is right on St. Catherine, but it's actually set back away. It has a very unobtrusive entrance and small lobby, not characteristic of hotels of it's quality. There was a small restaurant downstairs that never seemed to be open when we were in the lobby. Philips Square is lively and seems to have many vendors and performers daily. The rooftop terrace and pool were small, but nice. The staff and concierge are wonderful. We had requested a low floor due to a mobility issue, but one was not available our first night, we stayed in the junior suite, which was nice, but a little small and not very private. However, we received a free upgrade our second night since a low floor junior suite was not available, we were upgraded to the newest family suite for the same price. The suite was amazing and about as big as my apartment at home. The suites are located through a private door off the lobby. The suite itself had a hallway entrance, three closets, a separate second bedroom, two bathrooms, one with an amazing modern shower, a kitchen with an island, bar stools and every kitchen amenity you can imagine. It is an open floor plan and the living room is separated from the master bedroom by a huge panel with a flat screen tv on either side. There are high ceilings with hanging lights and beautiful prints decorate the whole suite. The best part was the windows that are high over the masterbed/living room and the curtains are electronic as you could never reach them. All of the lights in the suite are dimmers. It was very modern and luxurious. The hotel breakfast was very good and I am surprised at the bad reviews. There is a huge breakfast room on the second floor with two rooms, windows and a tv. The breakfast layout is very nice, modern and well staffed. There is a huge selection of items including, waffles, french toast, bagels, pastries, cereal, yogurt, oatmeal, juice, coffee, tea, etc. The food is not high end quality, but decent and a good quantity for being included.

Reviews.Title: “MONTREALS BEST ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: SalesGuyinCANADA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a several of Montreals downtown Hotels and recently discover Square Phillip. It is without a doubt the most accomadating, clean and spacious property in all of Montreal. Excellent staff, a wonderful authentic Italian restaurant and rooms that are amazing. Well worth the very reasonable price for this exceptional centrally located stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: powdering
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Our room was huge with a spacious bathroom, full kitchen and king sized bed. The location was ideal, in the centre of downtown and within walking distance of Old Montreal and Notre Dame, as well as the shopping and restaurant district around Rue Sainte Catherine O. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, large rooms, rooms need an update”
Reviews.Author: Wileyck
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. The staff was helpful and nice. The room was large, but it could use an update.

Reviews.Title: “ExcellentÂ¡Â¡Â¡Â¡Â¡Â¡”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent hotel. Very clean and the personnel always attentive and obliging. His ubicaciÃ²n is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very comfortable and spacious”
Reviews.Author: BMLNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after reading the recommendations on Tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed. Huge, sunny room, great kitchenette (though we wondered about having a full stove, and no pots or pans?) , and all very clean. Just a few metres to the main street, yet very quiet. We used the valet parking (quite expensive for three days!) but it worked for us. Breakfast was fine, great to have a guest laundry too. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again. Now, we would just like to pass on our comments about the BIXI bike hire - and there is a station just opposite the Phillips Hotel. We thought it would be a great way to explore the city but it was a big disappointment and hugely frustrating. . On the surface, it is reasonably priced and easy to hire a bike - $5 for 24 hours use for up to 30 mins at a time. Any more than 30 mins and then it gets quite expensive. BUT, the catch is, if there isn't any space in the bike rack at your destination, you have to ride on further and try to find one. And some of the bike stations weren't where the map said they should be. It resulted in us paying a lot more than we needed to. So, beware. We have used the similar bike hire system in London, England, and it worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: DGG2009
Reviews.Content: We had an enormous 2 Bedroom, living room, dining room, full kitchen, single bath for around $250 per might. The hotel is centrally located, near lots of sips & restaurants. The only problem was that every cab we used had to use a Gps or map to find 1193 Place Phillips.

Reviews.Title: “Huge suite, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LouiseSAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one night at this hotel. The room allocated to us was huge with a spotless kitchenette. The bathroom was massive too with plenty towels. The room was not fancy but it was comfy and the bed was also very comfortable. Breakfast on floor 2 was fine - nothing special but is already added into the room rate. You can take the bagels etc up to your room if you prefer. The pool area was really nice and the view from the terrace over the rooftops was amazing. The hotel is very central (a great location) and the staff on reception were very accomodating. We asked if we could check out a little later and they were amenable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a germaphobe”
Reviews.Author: PatrishaM
Reviews.Content: We visit Montreal on a regular basis. As a result, we have stayed in a vast array of hotels (good and bad). This past June we flew to Montreal for a couple of days and stayed at Le Square Phillips because of the reviews on Tripadvisor. To say that we were thrilled is an understatement. The most important detail at any hotel is cleanliness. To say that I am a germaphobe is an understatement, I travel with bottles of disinfectant and lysol. Not to mention I have a paranoia with bedbugs. Bed bugs are rampant around the world and the last thing any traveler wants to do is bring them home. Everywhere we go we thoroughly inspect mattresses and all furniture. I check everything for dust and dirtiness. This is the only hotel in Montreal that we have stayed at that is worthy of 5-stars - it is CLEAN! The breakfast served in the breakfast lounge is fantastic. I've yet to find a hotel that provides breakfast in this fashion (for free) to it's guests. It is definitely appreciated for travelers like us that are always on the go and do not have time to eat at a restaurant. The location is perfect. It's located 5 minutes from the transit system and is close to all amenities. This is the ONLY hotel we are going to be staying at for all future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and spacious”
Reviews.Author: suebg1
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, the room and bathroom were both spacious, clean and modern, and it had a full kitchen with table and chairs for 4. There was a pool and gym on the top floor (10th), which closed at 10pm. Didn't use it, but it looked more like a long thin lap pool, and was warm. Breakfast was ok, nothing special. 2-3 cereals, juice, apples, waffles (still frozen?) to toast, rock hard bagels, and generic sliced bread. The first day we took our small kitchen tray down and loaded it up with items, and ate those for the next couple of days for breakfast, so we didn't have to be up and down there before 9.30am when it closed. I thought the breakfast could have been much better, but I suppose any free breakfast is a bonus. The concierge was very helpful as were the front desk, and they stored our luggage after check out as our flight was later in the day. The location was just around the corner from a main shopping street, and access to the indoor shopping malls, and about 20mins walk to the more touristy old district and river front. Loads of restaurants about, several right outside the hotel front. Overall I would definitely recommend the hotel, it was so clean and spacious we would have been very comfortable for a longer stay than 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Went to Montreal for an Als game”
Reviews.Author: molly813
Reviews.Content: Professional and friendly staff, beautifully renovated building. Very spacious, well located and away from the hustle and bustle but well located. Beds and pillows were very comfortable. Had a suite, we entertained, would definitely go back. Neat view when you go to the top floor (10th)

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Relations”
Reviews.Author: jcsteelesd
Reviews.Content: As I paid for a room I am going to review the hotel. Poor customer relations. That's all I have to say about the hotel. Montreal was great and we had a wonderful time in the city as we do twice a year. Just will not be staying this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the awards!”
Reviews.Author: Ohjustpeachy
Reviews.Content: After much research I chose this hotel based on TA feedback, location, price & pool and I was really glad that I'd done that. It is worth the rate, it deserves the awards won and it's definitely worked by friendly, professional and helpful staff. The rooms are very spacious with huge windows, good sized bathroom and the kitchenettes are fully equipped including daily replenished tea & coffee! The free continental breakfast has lots to choose from (cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit, juices, various breads, preserves, muffins, croissants, waffles, tea/coffee - what more could you want from a continental?!) and the only negative is that midweek breakfast finished at 0930 (a little early for some tourists). The main shopping street (St Catherine) is right next to the hotel, you can walk most places (if you have the energy) within about 20 to 30 mins - the old town/port areas took us about 20 mins, Parc Mont Royal a bit more (uphill). Overall I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel to couples, groups and families - there's plenty of room in the suites and the location is great. ps For those like me it was also great to request and receive a smoking room - they can be hard to find these days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mindy92
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Montreal, couldn't have chosen a better hotel for price, location, friendly staff. Breakfast Free Wi Fi Free. Large clean room with Kitchen. We were in easy walking distance to shopping St Catherines street, the Bay and Eaton's centre & Old Montreal. Walked to Notre Dame Cathedral and Villa Saint Marie. Location couldn't have been any better and we felt safe walking back to the hotel late at night. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharpay10
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel for one night this past summer while passing through Montreal. This hotel is located close to the Via Rail/Amtrak train station and is near shopping. Check-in was easy and friendly. The rooms are very large. High ceilings, fridge, stove, table. Beds are really comfortable. Bathroom is large. The hotel has kind of a concrete, industrial feel because of the size of the rooms and the dÃ©cor, but overall it is clean and comfortable and an awesome value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above the rest”
Reviews.Author: martinsa
Reviews.Content: Have tried a handful of hotels in downtown Montreal. None of the others have come close to this experience. +Large rooms +Mini-kitchen and dining seating in each room +Nice television and entertainment system +Free wifi +Breakfast with decent buffet included +Excellent location in a nice area +Good, friendly staff -Not much of a view from the room -Fairly low bandwidth on the free wifi

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Attar1
Reviews.Content: We travel all over the world and have stayed at multiple hotels. This one is conveniently located in the heart of downtown this hotel has spacious, clean rooms, fast and free Wi Fi and a great staff with a friendly attitude. The breakfast is not the best but they have good coffee, again, for free. The room was $170/night and immaculate. it came with a fridge and a microwave oven.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel - large rooms!”
Reviews.Author: labenson56
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The desk staff and concierge were terrific: very friendly, always smiling, and full of good advice for enjoying the city of Montreal. We only needed a few extra towels during our stay and they were provided almost upon demand. Our room was huge and extremely clean. The breakfast was included: yogurt, fruit, bagels, toast, croissants, cereal, juices and good coffee. Old Montreal is a close walk and shopping on Rue Ste. Catherines is 2 blocks away. A great choice for staying in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families or Business or both”
Reviews.Author: Simon T
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Montreal and this was made easy by the wonderful service and accommodation at Le Square Phillips. From our arrival to departure everyone at the Hotel made our family of 5 very welcome. We were in Montreal for a conference combined with family holiday and the hotel is well located for getting around Montreal, in the evenings the boys enjoyed a swim in the pool. We found the positive reviews, information and photos to be an accurate representation of the accommodation and service provided. A great stay, we will return if in Montreal again, thank you to the team at Le Square Phillips.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: baltimooron
Reviews.Content: Super nice staff. Big rooms. Decent included breakfast. Location is good, and central- not in old Montreal, but a close enough walk. Room was very clean. Cleaning people always said hello and were friendly. Beds themselves were good, maybe not great, but the hotel is clean, and very well set up overall. This is one of the best experiences I've had in a big hotel in a long time. I had two little girls and we stayed in one of their large corner rooms. We got a promotional rate, and had a huge room that was just perfect for us. The rooftop pool is indoor and kept relatively cold, but it was nice to go for a swim after a day of walking around. I would have absolutely no hesitation booking this hotel, it really is what the reviews say about it- a super good place. I hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable experience!”
Reviews.Author: runningbarb
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Montreal after a weeklong cruise, planned to stay one night and then return home. We booked our night at this hotel after reading Trip Advisor comments. I can honestly say that 5 stars are not enough for this hotel. Our room was upgraded (not sure why) to a huge 2-bedroom suite, complete with kitchen and huge living/dining area. The room was spotless, the staff was helpful, location was perfect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: kiwi_mica
Reviews.Content: This is a well-run hotel with generous-sized rooms and good customer service. The breakfast is a bit so-so but it's hard to find anything else to complain about. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great rooms, would use again”
Reviews.Author: Valdave
Reviews.Content: Central hotel, clean, comfortale. Rooms were big and had everything we needed. Good location for local bars and restaurants. Bar et boeuf is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, good value, good location.”
Reviews.Author: jlamphere
Reviews.Content: Very roomy suites with kitchenettes, free wireless internet, good central location within walking distance of many areas of the city. The parking garage is very safe but a bit pricey. (Public parking lot next to the hotel would have been much cheaper at their weekend rate.) We biked a lot around the city and were advised to keep the bikes in our room, which was no problem in terms of space but a tight fit on the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel which is convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: LoneRock
Reviews.Content: Both me and my husband stayed at the Le Square Phillips Hotel & Suites this past weekend and i have to say we were very impressed. We had a suite with a kitchen including , so if you want to cook (we didn't) or just store stuff in the refrigerator your all set. They also have a nice rooftop indoor pool which was very clean and a decent continental breakfast which is included. Given its location to all the underground shopping, La Baie department store, Mc Gill (we would cut through La Baie to get to Mc Gill metro) and Square Victoria metro stops i would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel clerk saved the day”
Reviews.Author: nanog
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Montreal after 13 hours on a train. We went to what I thought was a suite and found a room with two beds. We were traveling with our two grown sons. I looked at my reservation and I had booked the wrong room. We need a eparate bedroom. There was nothing available for the two nights so the clerk put us up in a suite for one night and then moved us while we were out sight seeing the next day. I wish I had noted her name so I could thank her personally!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; great value!”
Reviews.Author: Grandmajoan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for five days and appreciated the ample size of the rooms, the cleanliness, the availability of a kitchen (although we barely used it), the friendliness of the staff, and the ample breakfast (the dark roast coffee was excellent) included in the room rate. We were two adult couples, but it would be an excellent choice for families with children because it has an indoor rooftop pool that was open until 10.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Nortguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed this hotel. It is in a great location. The rooms are very large, with a full kitchen and large bathroom. The staff was outstanding. Room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is a bit worn here and there. The included breakfast is very basic and, overall, of poor quality. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and has a pool.”
Reviews.Author: curiousnomad1
Reviews.Content: After thinking about different places to stay we chose Le Square- it was a perfect choice. We had thought about staying in Old Montreal, but that would not be a good choice with kids. This has it all, especially for families. The rooms are large with kitchens, there is a glass enclosed heated pool on the roof (not huge, but easily big enough for fun and not crowded), a floor on which breakfast is served, and a perfect central location. It is right off Square Phillips, a tree lined square with literally hundreds of restaurants nearby, including several connected malls (underground) with amazing food courts. (kids don't always want to spend 5 hours in a museum,nor do they want to eat at French restaurants. The hotel doesn't at all feel over-run with kids or families.) You can walk to most things (Cont. Art, Old Montreal, Basilica, McGill Redpath, Fine Arts and all downtown shopping. Plus it is close to two main Metro stops ( McGill or Square Victoria) that will take you to Biodome, Mont Royal, etc. The service was excellent - the first night our A/C wasn't as cold as I would like- the next day we moved to a new room that was very cool. After going to the front desk to request the change they made sure the temp in the new room was perfect. (it was warm outside). We parked our car there as well. All in all a great stay- book it now. We'll be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Book it now!”
Reviews.Author: pulu
Reviews.Content: An amazing all rounder.spot on for location, facilities, comfort, staff, quality and cleanliness. The plus is the great roof terrace and pool. A great base to have in montreal and would return without any hesitation. Thanks to all the tripadvisor comments for helping me choose this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great for family, would go elsewhere if couple”
Reviews.Author: mizzles
Reviews.Content: - Excellent location for shopping - lots of kids and babies - high ceilings in the rooms - average comfort bed - generous room size, including kitchen (which we never used though) - avg breakfast, the usual - toast, bagels, coffee, juice, muffins, cereal - clean - no lotions / bathroom amenities - solid internet connection

Reviews.Title: “Great space and terrific location!”
Reviews.Author: Tturner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Montreal with our 19-year old son and this place was perfect for us. We stayed in a 2-bedroom and the room was very spacious and had a full kitchen. The only downside was there was only 1 bath which we had to work around, but it was okay. There was lots of storage space for our things. The hotel itself is very clean but a little dated. They are going through some renovations which I noticed on the first floor by the elevators. The continental breakfast is exactly that ~ coffee, juice, and breads. If you are looking for more dining options you don't have to go far. There are many many restaurants to choose from right outside the hotel. The location is in the middle of everything and it is very safe. Anything that you want is nearby from shopping to clubs to museums to the metro. If you want to explore the city, this is an ideal location to base yourself. You can walk just about anywhere you want to go. There is noise outside the hotel at night from sirens to racing cars and motorcycles...but it is the city. Overall, we found this hotel to be an excellent value for our purposes. We had never been to Montreal before and this was a good place to see the city and enjoy coming back to at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “All that we wanted”
Reviews.Author: APCG-DeTriniTraveler
Reviews.Content: Writing this review while we are still here at the Hotel... Most importantly, Hotel room is as advertised; Too many times Hotels embellish. Perfectly Sized One Bedroom Family Suite that our daughter enjoys. Nothing Fancy, but we personally don't need that. Great Front Desk Staff Superb Location close to McGill Metro Station, Restaurants and Shopping on St. Catherine. Internet Works fine...important for me All in all, so far a great choice and all our needs have been met

Reviews.Title: “Good location, gigantic suites, great value.”
Reviews.Author: eisette
Reviews.Content: My third stay here. We booked a studio and a suite.They are large and well designed with fully equipped kitchen. Location is convenient, next to shopping and easy for sightseeing. Wonderful pool, good exercise room, laundry facilities. Friendly front desk and valet parking. Breakfast is not up to par with the quality of the hotel: food is bland and poor quality, very crowded at nine ,

Reviews.Title: “Ladies Weekend”
Reviews.Author: SeibD
Reviews.Content: Reviews were spot on! Great location next to shopping and events on St. Catherine Street and walking distance to many other venues and subway. Morning continental breakfast was nice variety and quality. Staff was very helpful with directions and all spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TwoTarHeels
Reviews.Content: Chose Le Square Phillips for a one-night family stay based on TripAdvisor reviews, and we weren't disappointed. We chose the family suite, which was truly huge; there was plenty of space for everyone. The room was a little spare, but entirely clean, comfortable, and quiet. Appreciated the fresh fruit and bagels at breakfast. The front desk and concierge staff were extremely helpful and attentive, from the friendly greeting on the phone when we made our reservation, to the concierge who guided us out into the street as we pulled away. Would be very glad to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQZA
Reviews.Content: As a family of four, we got the family suite and we loved it. It was spacious with a queen bed, double and pull out couch. All very comfortable. Hotel central to everything and the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “!= Business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Northrock
Reviews.Content: If you're here with your nine kids and need to fry eggs in your room this would be a wonderful place to stay. However, if while you are here and you need to connect securely to your business network back at home via their Internet it will suck to be you, as it sucked to be me, a la it just won't work (and don't even think to call the help desk).

Reviews.Title: “Gi-Normous Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BalhamBlonde
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the trip advisor reviews - and that was an excellent decision, so thank you fellow reviewers. I'd booked one of the bigger suites, with two separate rooms, one for me and the husband, one for girl teen and a sofa bed in the main room for boy teen- it was a huge space, just gi-normous, high ceilings, bright, very impressed, good sized TV's, everything you could want in the little kitchen, large fridge, all clean and tidy, good sized dining room table and 6 chairs, couple of easy chairs (and the two seater sofa bed). In fact I was already impressed months prior to our arrival, emailing the hotel was easy, very prompt replies. When I asked if they could help with car hire they were amazing, many thanks to the lovely Antonin. Convenient location. We even used the roof top pool (it was very hot in Montreal) and outside relaxing area. Free wifi (still horribly rare, and very much appreciated). Breakfast was fine, and included in the rate. They had this lovely fruit bread which when toasted was delicious. Kids liked the hot chocolate and the pancakes. If I had to gripe about anything, and I'm stretching here, it would be the tiny little cup/saucers they have. I like a good mug of tea in the mornings and I had to make several cups in order to satisfy my thirst, but hey, if this is the only problem then it's pretty darned good isn't it?!

Reviews.Title: “A great deal downtown Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Lucie2
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we found a good deal on the Internet for a junior suite. What a great decision we took! This hotel is located downtown Montreal (McGill metro) and its a couple of blocks away from festivals site (Jazz, Francofolies, Just for Laughs), a 15-minute walk from Old Montreal and Bell Center, and near underground shopping centers. The room was great, spacious, spotless clean and full of light, with contemporary design plus king size bed. Way better than any chain hotels. Continental breakfast was included and it was very acceptable if you are not expecting a 5 star buffet, it will do the job! There is a kitchenette in the suite and even if we didn't use it, it was well furnished and could be helpful for those interested in saving. We are from Montreal and, for sure, we will book that hotel in the next year or so.

Reviews.Title: “Travelling with 3 kids: Not easy; staying at Le Square Phillips: Easy!”
Reviews.Author: jordanrachelmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the hotel on the 10th floor. The hotel itself was great for the money. The kids had their own semi-enclosed area with a queen bed, and also a pull out couch that was apparently so comfortable that they fought over who got to sleep in it each night (this is coming from kids who HATE pull out couches when travelling). For the grown ups, we had our own large, spacious bedroom. Breakfast was included, which made it easy to just run downstairs and grab a bagel, yogurt, muffin, and some coffee and juices. The real bliss came for me, though, when I found out there was a laundry facility one flight up. Coin operated, easy, fast and convenient! That meant we didn't have to travel with out dirty clothes for the rest of our trip. Aaahh.... what a luxury! Only con was the staff was not overly friendly, but, who cares....? I've got enough friends already. LOL We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Eddie T
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our visit to Montreal, and it was great having Le Square Phillips Hotel as our home base for the weekend. It's in a great location within walking distance of the metro, Old Montreal, and various other attractions and restaurants. There's a parking lot right behind the hotel not affiliated with the hotel, if you want to save a few bucks on valet parking and you don't mind leaving your car parked there. (Use the valet if you want in/out privileges) The room was very large, and it had a full kitchen complete with dining table, oven, refrigerator, microwave, and dishwasher. The kids had fun running around the room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The swimming pool was nothing special (small and cold), but I enjoyed the view of the square (and the city) from the patio that encircled the pool on the top floor of the hotel. They also had lounge chairs and a small fitness room there as well. All in all, it's a wonderful place in a great location. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miko789
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in the hotel with the family. The hotel cant be beat in terms of location and size.. A Bonus is the complete kitchenette where you can cook or heat food if you like. It is very near St. Catherine where all the shopping and action is. Several walkable restaurants nearby along ST. Catherine. The suite is huge and very clean. Continental breakfast included in the package consisting of bread, cereals, oatmeal, fruits, yogurt, coffee, juice. Staff were helpful and courteous. It is a 10 to 15 minute walk to Old Montreal. Parking is for an additional fee of $22 although you can take the cab if you want. Business and fitness center available. Wireless internet in your room available. Would definitely stay here again. Highly recommended. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Happy With Our Choice”
Reviews.Author: ShopBread
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and were very happy with our choice. All staff was pleasant and helpful. Our room was larger than expected which was nice since we were staying with our kids. There was plenty of room for all of us! Centrally located in the city -- right around the corner from Rue Catherine and it's many stores including the "underground city". You could see The Bay department store from the hotel. We walked to Old Montreal and its sites -- a bit of a hike but recommend it since parking in that part of the city is difficult. Rate included breakfast in the morning. Would stay here again if visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great space for families!”
Reviews.Author: ttraveling
Reviews.Content: We had a junior Queen suite, and it was huge compared to most hotel "suites". Our kids were comfortable on the pullout couch in the living room, and there was plenty of storage space throughout. Loved the rooftop pool and outdoor deck! Breakfast was more continental than the usual American offering that includes hot food, but it was very adequate and the room attendants were efficient and friendly. Good downtown location - a 5-10 minute walk to several Metro stations, a couple blocks' walk to St. Catherine's Street, and a 15-20 minute walk to Old Montreal. Valet/concierge staff was most helpful in helping retrieve items from our car and in suggesting places for dinner. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: amysm
Reviews.Content: Wow, I can't say enough about this hotel. We booked a jr suite but were upgraded to a family suite at checkin without asking, This was basically a 2 bedroom apartment in the heart of Montreal. More space than you can imagine. 2 bedrooms, 2 tvs, a huge bathroom, fully equipped kitchen, living room, closets galore, free internet access and free breakfast all for a very reasonable price. Walking distance to St. Catherine street shopping and to the old city. We never needed the car which was safely valet parked for a fee. The roof top pool was just an added plus. Having never been to Montreal before I wasn't sure where to stay. So glad I chose this hotel. I would only stay here if ever in Montreal again. Wish I could find hotels like this one everywhere I travel with my teens.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or a family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: ClaudeC
Reviews.Content: I must have stayed at this hotel at least 25 times between 2004 and 2007 either for business or a family vacation. It was this time a real pleasure to return. Few of the staff has changed and after four years many oft hem remembered me. Still the same quality service. See their advertisement....I can assure you that they deliver. Best location and best deal in downtown MontrÃ©al, five minutes away from new Place des Spectacles and Place des Arts.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrankVanGool
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here with our family of 5 (3 kids between 12 and 14) for 1 night. We had an enormous suite, including fully equipped kitchen and seperate bedrooms. the (indoor) pool is located at the 9th floor and although small, it is great to swim "between buildings"; there is also a sundeck. Breakfast was included in the rate but limited choice and closed at 9h30. Valet parking to be paid. Good quality free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so”
Reviews.Author: brooklinefamily
Reviews.Content: The good: plenty of space for the 4 of us, including a full kitchen with a full fridge. There are 3 coin operated washers and dryers, in a very clean laundry room. Perfect for us as we were 2/3 of the way through our vacation and had no clean clothes. The people who worked at the hotel were nice and helpful. The not so good: there was a separate sleeping area with a big bed and a sleep sofa in the living room for the kids but the two spaces were not fully divided, there was one open wall. The location is not that great, it's a mile from old Montreal and close to Chinatown but it's in a very non-descript neighborhood near chain stores, no cute cafes, no charm at all. The hotel itself was more of a business hotel then a charming vacation hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a family trip!”
Reviews.Author: Beatrice07
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at Le Phillips Square. We had a very large room with a decent sized kitchen we used to make some meals. They had a nice continental breakfast and our kids enjoyed using the rooftop pool. We also enjoyed sitting on the rooftop deck at night and enjoying the view - we even got to see the fireworks competition from there! The old city is roughly a 20 minute walk, subway stations are nearby, and we even walked to Mont Royal. The staff was helpful and friendly. My only complaint was that the maid did not make up our room until 3 pm both days and we usually liked to be in the room then resting from morning sightseeing. However, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No better hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Kas55
Reviews.Content: To say I loved this hotel, is an understatement - it was one of my favourites ever! I loved the large, spacious and comfortable room, the fully equipped kitchen, the large bathroom with excellent showerhead, the great king size bed with super comfy pillows, the cleanliness and free internet and flat screen TV and the inclusive continental breakfast. The location is superb, the hotel is quiet, the staff super friendly and the valet parking quick and efficient. We will definitely only stay here when next in Montreal - it was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Still The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Porsche_Guy
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at Le Square Phillips Hotel & Suites marks our fourth summer at the hotel. This year we spent seven nights there during the Montreal Jazz Festival. The hotel, in my view, is the very best location from which to experience Montreal generally, and the jazz festival specifically. The hotel is within walking distance to - everything. Old Montreal, the waterfront, Mt. Royal, Rue Ste. Catherine, The Plateau, the subway. Really. Everything. There are several very cool things about Le Square Phillips Hotel in addition to its proximity to all things Montreal. The suites have a fully equipped and fully functional kitchen. This, in addition to the IGA grocery store nearby on Rene Levesque Blvd., means that one does not have to dine out for every meal during an extended stay in Montreal (unless of course, that's what you want). If in-room cooking is not your idea of fun, start the day with the free continental breakfasts in the hotel, then go nuts with great meals in the city the rest of the day. In addition, there is the pool, on the deck, the exercise room, and the laundry room. All very useful amenities during an extended stay. By the way, the view from the deck is fantastic. The suites are great in terms of space, for both living and storage. We are a couple, but with the fold-out couches in the living room a suite can easily be shared by a larger family. And yes, the hotel is animal friendly. We had a couple of dogs among the neighbors during our stay. (They were not intrusive, as the sound-proofing between rooms is quite effective.) The staff continues to be first-rate; fully fluent in English and French and more than willing to accommodate those of us who want to practice our French. Le Square Phillips Hotel & Suites is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of the beat hotels I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Rgabrielli
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time I have been to this hotel and I always plan on going back! The rooms are incredibly spacious, amazing roof top views from the sun deck. The staff are extremely nice and courteous. There is nothing to dislike about this hotel. My 1 suggestion is that they should start serving eggs for breakfast. For the price you really get what you pay for! Worth every dollar!

Reviews.Title: “Second time here and still great”
Reviews.Author: MH2806
Reviews.Content: It was so great to come back to Le Square Phillips and find it was as good as the previous time we stayed there 3 or 4 years ago. Our room was huge with two double beds, the bathroom was great and the kitchen area fully equipped. Housekeeping was spot on as well and there was free, fast, reliable wifi internet. But more than that it's the friendly and helpful staff that make Le Square Phillips so fantastic. The only improvement I could really suggest concerns the included continental breakfast. The offering is reasonably wide (muffins, croissants, bagels, toast, cereals, juices and some fruit plus tea and coffee) but some of the products provided seem to be of low quality. For example the croissants are a long way from freshly baked. Upgrading this offering, even without expanding the range, would make this excellent hotel stand out even further from the crowd. The hotel is well located for the Metro, within easy walking distance of McGill station. The Metro is fast, frequent and clean, with a 3 day pass good value at C$ 16 (around GB Â£10). It will get you just about anywhere you may want to go during your visit. It is also a reasonably easy walk to Vieux Montreal and there is great shopping on the doorstep with La Baie and Le Centre Eaton very close by. One thing we noticed with Montreal, and this is clearly nothing to do with the hotel but is provided for the benefit of Tripadvisor users, is that the number of aggressive beggars seems to have increased significantly over the last few years. We got abuse and spat at for refusing to give one who approached us any money. The city should look to address this.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute must in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Supapam
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here during the jazz festival and I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The staff was top notch. Very accommodating to every single request. The parking was very pricey but they valet park and it is indoors so you pay for that service. The rooms are great and we found the beds to be very comfortable. The hotel was located close to the jazz fest venues and walking distance to the Bell Centre, Chinatown, and other great little neighborhoods. The continental breakfast (included in the room rate) was adequate. Strictly breads and fruit and beverages. But it was enough to get us through until lunch and Montreal has more than it's share of wonderful eateries. Overall, this was a fantastic experience and I wholeheartedly recommend Square Phillips as a hotel choice in the city. I will definitely return with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, very, very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: cyberlion
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most spacious suites we stayed in travelling through Canada. Equipped with a kitchen and a full sized kitchen table (4 people). Being a married couple travelling with an adult daughter its not always easy to find suitable accommodation at a reasonable price. We did on this occasion at Le Square Phillips Hotel in central Montreal. Stayed four nights - it proved to be very enjoyable not only because of the large suite but we also loved the hotel's location and some of the nearby restaurants like Restaurant Julien and Beaver Hall Bistro. Our package included a continental breakfast which was OK. Average staff in breakfast room were out of kilter with the rest of the hotel's good staff. We did find having a kitchen useful on a couple of occasions. Happy to highly recommend. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “"Great" sums it up”
Reviews.Author: pyctravellingman
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in May 2011. The hotel is centrally located and within easy walking distance to shopping, restaurants, bars and Old Montreal. The rooms are unbelievably large with a full kitchen, clean and very quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful. There is a guest laundry on the top floor with three coin operated washers and dryers. The continental breakfast was adequate. Given the location and size of rooms, the hotel offers good value for money. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent”
Reviews.Author: QCTraveller2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family trip -- two families meeting up needed a suite hotel. Le Square Phillips once again came through for us. We had stayed here before and found the rooms to be large and comfortable, the kitchen size generous and well equipped and the service all around reliable. Our extended family were completely impressed with the size of the rooms, and the well appointed kitchen. Amenities were nice too, roof top work out area and pool. We were able to entertain guests in our suite and cook an entire dinner for them, just like at an apartment. Location is excellent too, set off the street enough to be quiet, walking distance to many key Montreal sights and the Metro. Because this is a converted commercial property each room is unique, and there are wonderful high ceilings, as well as interesting architectural drawings used as art throughout. Feels unique!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful huge suite, great location - we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Gabi42
Reviews.Content: Very clean, spacious suites, friends staff, super location for an excellent price. Our stay was very pleasant. Wonderful views from the top floor deck.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: valerita
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last year.Have been to Montreal many times over the years and this was by far the best hotel.Large suites.High ceilings.Great hotel staff and very quiet.Close to everything especially shopping!Booked through Expedia.Got a great deal.Will definitely book again.Have recommended to others with great feedback

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Suite”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTell
Reviews.Content: What a great downtown location and a loveley spacious suite. It has all the mod cons except a laundry which is available one floor away. Beautifully furnished and equipped - at least a 4 if not 5 star by Australian standards. Excellent service by front desk and concierge on various matters. A continental breakfast is included. A very large IGA supermarket is located 2 blocks away and a liquor outlet is a little closer. Taxi in from the airport is a standard $38 CA. So much to see and all within 3km radius so lots of walking opportunities./ Excellent value. Rooms as portrayed on website.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor and Venere.Com are right”
Reviews.Author: zeniatrips
Reviews.Content: All reviews indicated price to quality ratio was among the best. Trip Advisor is not the only one to point in that direction. This is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem, tons of room, great location, excellent prices”
Reviews.Author: eddieharris
Reviews.Content: I found this delightful hotel on TripAdvisor, and couldn't agree more with the reviews. They were having a special where every second night was 50% off, so I ended up paying around $125 per night for a room bigger than my apt., with a full size kitchen, dishwasher, stove, full sized fridge w/freezer, microwave, dining table and chairs, and a wonderful bed, shelves, desk, I WANTED TO MOVE IN! Quiet rooms, great location, nice people, beautiful pool and fitness room on top floor with wonderful views. If you like to save money by buying and preparing your own meals (well, at least breakfast), I would stay here. Oh, and on top of everything, they did have free breakfast, which I didn't try. You can't go wrong, esp. with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Spacious Room, and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: travel550
Reviews.Content: For a 3-star hotel, this hotel is as good as it gets. The first thing we noticed was how big the room was- high ceiling and spacious floor plan.
