Considering our double-room included a kitchen and dining table/chairs, it was amazing that we had more than enough room for a third roller bed. 3 of us sharing 1 room didn't feel crowded at all. The furniture itself was pretty basic- nothing fancy. Bed was firm and comfortable enough, though sheets were a little too stiff for my preference. I was grateful for thick curtains that blocked morning sunlights coming through the sizable windows when we wanted to sleep late- which was most of time for Montreal has a great night life! And rooms were very quiet at night so there was no worrying about poor sleeping because of noise. The hotel staffs were very nice and helpful. And the maid service was very prompt when we needed. The only thing I noticed was that the cleaning was not as thorough as I am used to with other 4-5 star hotels, but it wasn't noticeable enough to bother me. For travel purposes, the location was perfect. It's central to downtown area- only a block south of St. Catherine and underground city stores, and it's sandwiched in between McGill and Square Victoria metro stations. It takes only 10-15 min walking to Old Montreal and China Town, and about $7-11 taxi ride to St. Laurent and St. Denis (where all the fabulous restaurants are) to the east, and Crescent Street to the west. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway for a couple because Old Montreal area has lots of plush options for that. However, for a quick 5-day trip to experience the Montreal's city life with friends at reasonable cost, we couldn't have gotten a better hotel. I have to say thank you to tripadvisor again for helping me finding a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Heartmontreal
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel recommended by a Neice and then by using Montreal tourism Sweet deal pkg. It was absolutely perfect the staff were extremely helpful with directions and even booking restaurant reservations. The room was large with the high vaulted ceilings and little kitchenettes. It really was a "Sweet Deal" Montreal is a fabulous place to visit and tour. The location is soooo perfect. for Shopping, Metro, Old Montreal,This is one city you will never have enough time to see everything.I can't wait to go back and definitly will book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for odd numbers of roommates”
Reviews.Author: N0tL0stJustWandering
Reviews.Content: We were visiting for a conference at the conference center and were looking for something cheaper than the conference hotel. This hotel had suites with two beds and one sofabed that allowed three of us to share a room for a great deal (for the area...it's a big city, things are generally pricey). The suite was huge: kitchen with table, largest bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel, and generous bedroom and living room spaces. I've lived in apartments smaller than this suite. The gym, my roommate reported, was adequate, and the morning breakfast varied and tasty. Great location within walking distance of shopping, conference center, and tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, especially for families with older children”
Reviews.Author: TwitchyEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed 3 nights at the hotel in a family suite. The family suite was very spacious with a living area and a kitchen/dining area much like an apartment or condo. The extra space was nice and gave everyone room to watch TV, use their laptop or read a newspaper without bothering each other. The hotel offers a free continental breakfast and internet with your room. Within easy walking distance of the hotel is all the shopping and restaurants you will need for your stay in Montreal. There's a nice Italian restaurant adjacent to the hotel, not cheap but the food was very good. The suite was very clean and the beds were excellent. We had a very enjoyable stay at the hotel and would definitely use the hotel again on our next visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for your MontrÃ©al trip”
Reviews.Author: Big_Blue_Boy_21
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with my 5 day visit; staff was extremely friendly, helpful and polite. The room was huge, comfortable, quiet and very well kept. My suite had a kitchenette which was better than my kitchen at home. The breakfast was a little lacking (no hot food) but it was free and plentiful. Easily the best of five hotels I've said at in downtown MontrÃ©al: great price, great location, great hotel - I'll be coming back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “ROOOMY and the best place for family stay, one slight problem”
Reviews.Author: SMA-ESI
Reviews.Content: (+) : roomy , VERY well equipped , perfect service , clean , comfortable , free valet ($parking) (-) : no Fan in the toilet ! , free but cheap breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: c21579
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best value in Montreal. I will never stay anywhere else when traveling there. Rates are very reasonable. The rooms are huge, comfortable, clean, nice, updated. The small kitchens are very useful when travelling with family. Very clean and complete. The best part of this hotel is that pets stay for FREE!! How wonderful is that. Now a days hotels make you pay per pet, per night, making traveling with your pets more expensive than traveling with children!!!, Finding a hotel that does not try to rip you off feels fantastic. Breakfast is included, its nothing spectacular, but there is coffee, bagels, cereals and other basics. And, hey, its free!!! The location is unbeatable, close enough to walk to the old port and right next to mayor shopping and restaurants. The hotel staff is friendly, polite, helpful, and wonderful. Always greet my children with a complementary toy. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You must try this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CDNTravelerOttawa
Reviews.Content: Over all a fantastic experience. Large clean rooms, great service, great location. The pool could be a bit warmer for the little ones, but shouldn't deter anyone from trying this lovely hotel. I'll go back again & again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: secretdragonfly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is our "home away from home" whenever we travel to Montreal (several times a year). It continues to be a great value, particularly when you factor in the continental breakfast being included. I also wanted to make a special mention of the resto a few doors down from the hotel, called Pizza Il Focolaio. We stopped by on a whim and picked up some pizza to bring back to the room and I have to say it was one of, if not the, best pizza we've even had. Made a real wood-burning oven, the crust and the toppings were perfect and it was very reasonably priced. We'll definitely be back on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Beachlove08
Reviews.Content: What's Great: Large Room and Large Bathroom with sunken bathtub convenient to everything, even the deluxe room has a kitchenette. great price, but if you want a boutique hotel with lots of charm, this is not it. This is a family friendly hotel, so the breakfast area on the 2nd floor can get a bit overwhelming. The complimentary breakfast is equivalent to let's say "Econo Lodge" so don't expect it too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RB815
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Montreal and this hotel helped make this trip one to remember. Its location is wonderful- right next to St. Catherine street where there are lots of restaurants, bars, shops, and an entrance to the underground city. We rented a king studio which was very clean, spacious, and enjoyable. The staff was friendly and very helpful. We would definitely stay at this hotel again, however you nay want to look at locations in old Montreal- we thought that part of the city had more culture and life, although this location was wonderful as well

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: bravissimo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Square Phillips Hotel & Suites during our Xmas getaway. Long before our stay we communicated with the desk and received prompt, quality answers and advice which really helped us later. Check-in was a breeze, concierge was top notch in handling our luggage, arranging transportation and guidance. Family suite was clean, modern and in great condition. Hotel location was A-1 too, close to pretty much everything we needed. Breakfast was a bit of disappointment (crowdy, closed @ 10 am, limited food) but we good with our kitchenette. Next time in Montreal we will definitely consider Le Square Phillips Hotel & Suites as our place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Familytravellers77
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week for work. Had my family join me on the week end. Largest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Was in 1010. Think all the number 10 rooms on each floor are enormous. Breakfast was a bit basic but did the trick. Superb location for restaurants and shopping in spare time. Only downer was the gym was a bit small and the equipment was quite dated. Small but beautiful pool. Also no hotel bar, which I almost consider a must on business trips. The restaurant attached to the hotel was quite lovely if not open all the time.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: ardella63
Reviews.Content: If you appreciate a very well maintained, exceptionally clean and comfortable hotel, this is for you. I had a one bedroom with queen bed, large living / dining room and small fully equiped kitchen. It was simply furnished but had wonderful lighting with high ceilings and corner moldings. All linens and bath products were plentiful and of very good quality. Housekeeping was impeccable both in the room and common areas. The roof top area with excercise room, in door pool, outdoor terrace ( really enjoyed the flowers) , and laundromat were small but never crowded. Complimentary breakfast , although not hot, was always fresh with plenty of bagels, croissants, cereal, juice, fresh fruit and coffee......would have been nice to have some variety from day to day. The front desk staff were professional yet friendly and helpful with directions/information...really liked talking with Phillip. Shopping on St Catherine street was only 2 blocks away but there didn't seem to be many nice restaurants close to hotel. The pizza place next to hotel was quite good. Old Montreal is about a 20 minute walk through a very pleasant area including a park. Be sure to see the Basilica Notre Dame and eat at one of the many French restaurants. There is so much positive to say about all of Montreal and the hotel, I definitely want to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best That Montreal Has To Offer!”
Reviews.Author: ChocolateRalphy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a pleasure. Large clean quiet! room with high ceilings, a comfortable bed, functional kitchen and roomy bath; continental breakfast room on the second floor. Walking distance to museums and shopping; great little Asian noodle restaurant right down the street. The staff are wonderful, look no further .......................

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor does it again!”
Reviews.Author: RJB72
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent had suggested another hotel for our 3-night stay, but we booked here because of reviews for this hotel. We are so glad we did! It must have been a quiet time because we were upgraded to a suite - a first for us. :)) With an entry hall, large lounge room, kitchen / dining area, two sleeping areas and big bathroom, it was as big as some houses! High ceilings added to the space and the kitchen contained everything necessary. The whole was spotless. It was wonderful after having lived out of a suitcase for the previous four weeks and sometimes falling over each other in poky hotel and B&B rooms. Even if we had stayed in a basic room, I'm sure we would have been equally impressed. The pool area was secure and clean, (although a clock would have been handy); it was a pleasure to use the laundry (very clean, bright and with a view over the surrounding area); and the buffet breakfast suited us just fine. The location was ideal; close to main streets, the subway, underground shopping and a few blocks from the 747 bus to the airport. (Remember to have the exact fare.) There are two small supermarkets and a fruit stall nearby in rue Ste Catherine. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Sebastian. We would certainly stay here when visiting Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “A real find . . .”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPerk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Square Phillips the nights of Nov. 1 and 2 to attend a nearby business meeting. First trip to Montreal. Hotel is in a great location - lots of bars and restaurants, underground shops nearby. A couple of blocks from the McGill stop on the Metro. My suite was huge - more like a downtown apartment than a hotel. Very clean. Art deco decor. Bed was comfortable. Free wifi (ask for the access code when you check in). Occasional distant outside noise but nothing that kept me awake (what do you expect - you're in the middle of the city). Staff was friendly and helpful. Everytime I was in the lobby, they were attentive and ready to assist without being overbearing. Breakfast is served on the second floor - for someone looking for something quick and light, it was more than adequate. A hotel with character.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and has secure parking.”
Reviews.Author: JoeRock
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel within walking distance of Old Town and steps from Ste. Catherine street shopping. Breakfast is plain and simple but good. The pool isn't that big or deep but good for lengths. Valet parking is indoors and secure. Staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: sanrom
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, good rate. The restaurant in the hotel is pretty good also. I will be going back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Four star hotel with one star breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: newt46
Reviews.Content: We got this recommendation from tripadvisor.com, and it really paid off. Terrific location in the heart of Montreal. About a block East of University Av., which is the main approach into the city from the U.S., and near several Metro Stops. We took a suite, which allowed us and our kids space to spread out, and get away from each other, and prepare meals during our three night stay. Staff was very helpful and welcoming The concierges were especially so, although occasionally away from their posts, as they doubled as parking attendants. Pool is small, but rooftop location a real plus. Nice laundry came in handy. I have to mention one negative. The comp "continental" breakfast was a disappointment. Breakfast room was pleasant and staff courteous and efficient, but food was uninspired to say the least. A true continental breakfast would have fresh croissants , french bread, jams, and good coffee. What they had were thawed frozen croissant-ish pastries, and American style bread, generic cold cereals, and mediocre coffee. Even a Comfort or similar modest motel breakfast would have hard-boiled eggs and yogurt, but not here. I don't want to go on too much about the breakfast. It was most notable as a contrast to the overall excellence of our experience, and at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for a family”
Reviews.Author: ACG-NL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one-bedroom family suite and it was perfect for our family of five - 2 adults and our 3 children aged 3, 6 and 8. It was very spacious. My brother and sister also stayed in the hotel at the same time in studio suites (family of 4 and 3) and were impressed by the size. There wasn't actually that much of a size difference but we had a separate bedroom and also a larger kitchen area. The place was spotless. We enjoyed the roof top pool although we our party of 12 we filled it up and others arrived and understandably ignored the size that indicated the limit was 12 people. Breakfast was fairly crowded on the weekends and when some items ran out they were not replaced but the selection was good and I always appreciate breakfast being included.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Quagmire88
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights here, the room was huge with a kitchen and dining table. it also had a massive, very comfortable bed. The location was great, very central. Continental breakfast was provided and was fine. Perhaps a little unneccessary as we had the kitchen to make toast etc. If breakfast was going to be available maybe it would have been better to have a hot option. There was also a small gym and pool on the roof, which was nice to have also a useful cheap laundry room. The only real problem we had was with housekeeping, there was no directory in the room outlining the hotel's services so we had to constantly call reception to ask questions regarding the pool, breakfast etc, When we asked reception about the directory we were told to call housekeeping for it, when we did, housekeeping refused to send it up, saying it was unavailable and were actually quite rude to us. This was all a bit of a shame and unnecessary. Also the kettle in the room was unusable as it was pouring out black bits in the water. We daren't call housekeeping! Apart from these small problems, we would still recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, convenient and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: capellirossi
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Le Square Phillips. We were greeted very warmly by staff at reception when we arrived. Our room was large and spacious. It had a full kitchen at one end of the large room, a table for 4, a somewhat firm but comfortable bed, an easy chair, TV, full closet and other nooks and cubbyholes for belongings. We liked the exceptionally high ceilings (guessing they are 16 - 20 feet) which gave the room an open and airy feeling. We had 2 windows overlooking a street. Bathroom was typical of any hotel, nothing special. Our "very good" rating for the sleep quality is based on our preference for a somewhat softer mattress but we had no trouble sleeping on the firm mattress. Good pillows. Hotel was very quiet during our stay. Breakfast was included in the price and was ample. It was self-serve with huge urns of different types of coffee, hot water for tea, 2 large hotel-style toasters for bagels, bread, etc., cereal, fruit, yogurt. We paid 182 Canadian for a Thurs and 162 for Fri. The hotel also has a concierge service and Wi-Fi. The location is excellent as it is between Rue Ste.-Catherine and Boul. Rene-Levesque and close to Montreal's underground shopping malls and several Metro stops. It is bounded by Sherbrooke St and McGill Univ. to the north, U of Quebec-Montreal to the east, and Vieux Montreal and the port to the South. It was a fairly easy walk for us to visit the restaurants and shops in the Rue Prince Arthur-Rue St. Laurent area to the northeast. There is also a decent pizzeria a few doors away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient. Friendly and safe.”
Reviews.Author: DwightKSchrute
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice and friendly hotel. The rooms aren't ultra-fancy or high-design, but if you're looking for a place to stay with your family, especially with a kitchen, this hotel is perfect. The pool is smallish, but so pretty, and up on the roof, which makes it fun. Everything is very clean. The staff was so friendly and helpful. We found that we could walk to many of our destinations, and were close to the subway, even when the concierge or doorman suggested a cab. It's not much of a lobby and it's not on the prettiest street, but we felt so welcome by the staff and had a great time. It is a good value. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: swanster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a few nights 3 years ago and right then and there I decided that this will be THE hotel for us in Montreal. We booked a 2 bdrm suite for a night in August during our return leg from Atlantic Canada to Toronto. The vehicle was valeted for the night so we skipped the nightmare of having the van valeted everytime you make a quick stop at the hotel. The rooms all have high ceilings, huge windows, kitchens if you so desired to cook your own meals. When I'm on vacation, I do not cook but it's nice to have the choice. Beds are comfortable, bathroom well stocked, lots of lights so the rooms are bright. Elevators are small though but it's an old building so we accept the minor inconveniences. Love the location of the hotel. It's central and you can walk anywhere from there. We walked to Chinatown, the old port, the art museum and beyond. Ste. Catherine can be trashy at night but that's part of the charm. Unfortunately the stretch towards the village is under heavy construction but it's not the hotel's fault. If you're traveling with teen and early 20's kids, make sure you send them out to Simons to shop for clothes. It's trendy and not overpriced. Continental breakfast is complimentary on the 2nd floor. Not a lot of choices but when faced with real Montreal bagels with cream cheese, nothing else mattered. We stayed one night but was presented with a $700+ bill. CHECK your bill! We got charged for one week's parking instead of overnight but it was promptly credited to our credit card. Whew! This hotel is located between Ste. Cath and Rue Rene so you do hear a fair bit of sirens back and forth but strangely enough, it did not disturb my sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfslinky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Square Phillips and were happy with our choice. This was our first time in Montreal and we found it to be centrally located. Our room had a full-sized kitchen with a stove, oven, microwave, dishwasher and large refrigerator. We even had a toaster, electric tea kettle and coffee maker in the room. An adequate continental breakfast was included in the rate. Our room had a tray so we had the option of bringing breakfast up to our room if we didn't want to eat in the dining room. We were a few blocks away from the Square-Victoria Metro station, and a few bus lines. The new 747 Airport Express is about five blocks away from the hotel and gets you to/from the airport in about a half hour. There is a small pool, outdoor deck, mini gym, laundry room, and a free business center with two computer stations in Le Square Phillips. There is also free internet in the rooms. We found the staff to be extremely friendly, helpful, and check-in was extremely fast. We were happy with our stay and cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel/Nice Deck & Pool/Location Overrated”
Reviews.Author: schoolyd
Reviews.Content: Previous postings accurately describe the hotel, with highlights being the large, clean rooms, kitchens, free wifi, laundry facilities, reasonable valet parking rates, helpful concierges, and really nice rooftop pool/deck, No complaints there. I did not really like the location of the hotel despite others praising its central location. Rue Katherine is a pretty busy commercial street with a lot of seedy people. No one bothers you, but when I go on a vacation, I guess I am selfish and like to see the world as I would like it to be and not as it is. The kid friendly stuff is really centered in the old town/port area, which is a 25 minute walk from the hotel. The subway is very good, but it gets to be a drag to have to use it constantly. Again, in the real world, subway is fine. On vacation, I prefer convenience. So in sum, if you are on business or maybe a couple without kids, the hotel is probably good value, but with kids, i would recommend choosing closer to the old town/port or bypassing Montreal altogether. I was not a big fan of Montreal as a family destination. The Botanical Gardens are nice, but pales in comparison to the ones in Vancouver and even falls short of Longwood Gardens, which is in the Philadelphia area. The Jean Talon market is vastly overrated and is out of the way and in a rather shoddy neighborhood. The amusement park, La Ronde, was nothing special. In all, the old town is nice, but falls well short of Quebec City. The crepes are good, of course. The town may be fun for a couple given it is biker friendly, but if I did it over I would have combined Vermont/Quebec City or Main/Quebec City and eliminated Montreal from my plans.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, convenient, roomy”
Reviews.Author: JMVermont
Reviews.Content: a great place to stay! We go up to Montreal for an overnight stay a couple times a year. We've tried lots of hotels there over the years, and find ourselves coming back to Le Square Phillips. Great shopping at Les Ailes, just a block away, and easy access to the subway. The staff are friendly and efficient and the rooms are comfortable and roomy. The breakfast is not great, but we just go to the Second Cup a few doors away. We've stayed in a lot of hotels that looked as nice but turned out to be terribly noisy - I never hear a thing from other rooms at Le Square Phillips and the beds (even the sofa beds!!) are suprisingly comfy (a big thing for me). We always end up walking to Chinatown for food to eat on our drive home. It's not that far and is easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness, Convenient, close to transit buses ans Metro”
Reviews.Author: stromboliCalgary
Reviews.Content: We spent one week at this hotel on the 6th floor. We were quite surprised having a fully equipped kitchen, ( stove,microwave, fridge,dishwasher,toaster,coffee-maker and kettle) Utensils were adequate right down to a wine-opener, this was very convenient for us as we invited 2 friends to share snacks and drinks before going to dinner. A continental breakfast was served every morning. ( juices, cereals, yogurt, muffins, bagels, croissants and waffles.) If you decide to do grocery shopping there is a full market just 3 blocks away. The hotel is earth-friendly and provides re-cycling bins in the rooms.Our room maid Rosa is a gem , kept everything in order. Would we go back ??? definitely !

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: danielh5
Reviews.Content: We visited with our 11 and 5yo boys. The rooms was just immense. We stayed in a suite with one queen and one double (sleeper sofa). The room had an eat-in kitchen and walk-in closet. The hotel was clean and the staff was mostly friendly. The rooftop pool was nice, clean yet small. It cost us around $160/night before taxes. Parking was expensive at around $30/night (valet only). There were lots of restaurants and shopping nearby, and it was a quick walk to the Old Montreal area (mostly downhill). We'd stay there again in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Simply parfait!”
Reviews.Author: wwwnyc
Reviews.Content: We hadn't heard of Le Square Phillips before we decided to stay 3 nights there two weeks ago. During our one previous visit to Montreal, we were at the W Hotel in Victoria Square. We were glad to be at Le Square Phillips this time around. While the W was plush and heavenly, Le Square Phillips was much more practical and better situated, and had some of the best service of any hotel we'd stayed in before. The suite we were at was also the most generously sized suite we'd even been in. The kitchen was well-stocked and allowed us to dine in, keeping food costs down. (Besides, produce in Montreal is amazing, and we were glad to have been able to sample it in the comforts of our hotel room. A salad and some smoked meat and good bread from one of the many bakeries-- yum!) The free breakfast was continental, but great to start the day with, and the pool was small but well-kept, and long enough to get a proper lap swim in. And it was nice to have free wi-fi, as we had to do some work while we were away. We highly recommend this hotel for families, and for anyone staying long-term.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, with a roof top pool”
Reviews.Author: tencom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the nicest we stayed at on our road trip, if we ever went back to Montreal this is the place I would stay. I can't speak about any other hotels in Montreal but this one deserves a high rating. Nice friendly staff, great rooms, nice breakfast on the second floor. loved the pool on the roof with a great view of downtown Montreal. within walking distance of many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like our own apartment”
Reviews.Author: Sharpay10
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night in July and one night in August. We arrived in Montreal by train so we were looking for a hotel close to the station. We usually stay at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth which is right above the train station, but it's a bit expensive so we decided to try this hotel for a change. Got a decent rate as I booked in advance. The location of this hotel is good. It is close to the train station and many other amenities. The Baie and St. Catherine Street are right outside your door if you like to shop and it seems to be in a good location for other attractions as well. We didn't have time to venture out too far, so I can't comment on that. The lobby of the hotel is small, but nice. We arrived early and our room was ready which was great. The rooms are HUGE. It really is like your own little apartment. Kitchen area with fridge, microwave, sink, dishes, table. We found everything very clean and comfortable. Beds are hard, but comfy. They also offer grocery service. This hotel also has a sundeck and a small indoor pool and fitness centre. They also have onsite landry facilities. There is free breakfast at this hotel which was lovely - good selection and the option to eat in your room if too busy in the breakfast room. The only thing I would comment on were the elevators. This is a fair size hotel, but the elevators are VERY small which meant that only a couple of people with suitecases could travel in them, which resulted in longer waits. Overall I thought this was a great place. Would highly recommend, especially if staying for a week or more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - on every count”
Reviews.Author: helensburgh77
Reviews.Content: positives - great location , handy for shopping ( malls & St. Catherine St ), cinema, and close enough to walk to Old Montreal ( about15 minutes ) and other central areas ( UGAM ) - staff in hotel were uniformly excellent in friendliness and service - free internet in the business centre - breakfast is included and , while continental only , has plenty of choice and is quick and efficient to use - room was massive, with nice airy feel to it - efficient lift service - in room fridge for snacks and drinks negatives - not too many convenience stores nearby - just need to buy snacks at opportune times - nothing of note

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: jonnyboy83
Reviews.Content: You really couldn't ask for a better location-- it is walking distance to both Old Montreal & the shops on St. Catherine (which are in opposite directions). The concierge was very knowledgeable. We called to ask for more towels and pillows and someone was at our door in less than a minute. The rooftop patio is great. Stay here- you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “One Terrific Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mjovis
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. The hotel was quiet and very well-kept. The room was large and well appointed (formerly an industrial building, so the ceilings were high and there was a large mushroom shaped column in the middle of the room). The kitchen was well-equipped, allowing us to make our breakfast each morning (although there is a satisfactory continental breakfast included), or have a snack. There is small pool, fitness center and outdoor deck on the top floor (with a great view). The staff was always pleasant and helpful (including our arrival, when my GPS couldn't find the hotel and I had to call. The Concierge gave us directions, and cell phone, flagged us down when we finally found the right street.) We availed ourselves of the valet parking (at $22/day extra). Our car was quickly made available, on the few occasions we used it. The location was ideal: two blocks from the Metro, across from a park and a Bixie rental bicycle stand; and near lots of shopping and restaurants. Finally, the price was reasonable. If and when we return to Montreal, we would stay at the Le Square Phillips again. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Kitchen is only adequate”
Reviews.Author: PollyNomial
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, this is a great hotel. The location was fairly good, although it's not a neighborhood per se. This is in the CBD. But the area felt safe at night. The valet staff were extremely professional, intelligent and kind. We had never done valet parking before in our lives but it was well worth the $22 per night. We left something in the car and one of the valet's took me to our car. I would never have been able to park our van the way they did and the security system seemed strong. We did not have to worry about our car being broken into. Also, we had the valet deliver our luggage to the room and remove it at the end. It was a huge help! Well worth the cost of the tip. We had a king bed one bedroom unit. It was very clean and nice. The housekeeping staff were very friendly and worked very hard. Our bed was comfortable and the kids slept on the double sofa bed which was fine for them. We faced the rear surface parking lot. It had bright lights on 24 hrs. a day but the curtains were light blocking so it was never a problem. On some mornings, a trash truck came which we heard but it wasn't terribly bothersome. We were on the 3rd floor. We could not hear any neighbors and thus I don't think they could hear us as our children screamed and yelled at each on occassion (or was that me yelling at them?). My minor complaint was the kitchen. Having travelled to many countries and stayed at similar types of apartment hotels, I wouldn't call this well stocked. It only had four of everything so if you wanted to use a fork to serve something, good luck. There were only four forks and we were four people eating so we had to improvise. There was no tea pot, just a hot water kettle. The tea cups were so small I went to a store and purchased a mug as I didn't want to make a million little teas. There were a few flimsy serving utensils but not much else. There were only four plates, four bowls (again tiny) and a metal collander, one metal bowl and two metal pots and one metal pan. THere were no serving dishes for anything. Even though there is a full stove and oven and microwave, it is difficult to make much to eat for a family of four here. The microwave is so small you couldn't fit much into it. THis was the point of our staying here - to be able to eat dinner at the hotel rather than a restaurant and then go out on the town again- saving money for other things. If you really need to cook, get things that can get boiled, heated in a pan or small individual servings that can be microwaved. The breakfast was great. You can take a tray from the room down to the breakfast room and bring things back to your room. THis is particulary helpful for a family as the room gets quite busy. I went down at 7 am and got what my family needed and we ate in the comfort of our own room. I loved that. There is an IGA grocery store in the Complex Desjardins on avenue Renee Levesque, about a 10 minute walk (or more). Remember to bring your own bags or you will be charged for each plastic bag you need. Overall, the hotel was good but personally, I wished we could have found an apartment to rent in a small neighborhood and a had a better stocked kitchen. I searched and this was the best I could find.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: susana77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance of metro stops, underground tunnels and shops, and old Montreal. The rate includes free internet access and a continental breakfast. The gym is nothing to call home about but it'll certainly help you to maintain your fitness routine. The rooms are big, and the kitchen is fully equipped. Full size refrigerator with top freezer, dishwasher, microwave, and full size range. There's a small supermarket a few blocks away but you can also leave your grocery list in the front desk and they'll get the groceries for you. We booked through the Montreal Official Tourist Information website and got a really good deal (3x2 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with character !”
Reviews.Author: Happybluenoser
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at Le Square Phillips Hotel and Suites (July 12-18, 2010) and had a wonderful vacation.. We were so impressed with the unique hotel accomodations - huge room with 12 foot ceilings, large ktichen area with stove/oven, full size refridgerator, sink , dishwasher , large flat screen TV, king size bed, FREE internet access and located 1/2 block to main shopping district (Sainte Catherine's St) and 10 - 15 minute walk to the Old Port of Montreal and Bell Centre. The free continental breakfast was great- lots of Montreal bagels provided (along with cereals, muffins, bread, waffles, variety of juices, fruit, milk and tasty coffee). The 2 breakfast rooms on the 2nd floor were very clean and well staffed every morning. Great for singles, couples and families. The front desk staff and concierge were very friendly and accomodating. They allowed us to check in early when we arrived and check out an hour late when we departed. I recommend the Italian Trattoria restaurant off the main lobby , the service was great and we had an excellent pasta dinner one evening. We also ordered room service and the delicious pizza's were made at this restuarant. The hotel rooms seemed very sound-proof and we had no complaints about noise. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay in Montreal. The rooms are very spacious and the location is very convenient and a 5 minute walk to 2 different Metro (subway) stops.We also recieved a CAA/AAA discount when we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: sherman220
Reviews.Content: Went with husband and kids (ages 13 and15). We don't speak french and the saff went out of their way to assist with advice. I get up at 5 for an early am walk and staff made sure I had umbrella, water etc. Room is huge and very clean, Kitchen helpful for storing leftovers, wine and beer. Location couldn't be better for shopping (St. Catherine St.) and we ended up walking to all parts of the city, never took car or train. Roof top pool a nice bonus and breakfast inluded was just what we needed to get us tthough until a mid day lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Good city centre choice”
Reviews.Author: elegantraveller
Reviews.Content: Finding accommodation for three adults travelling together can be a challenge, and suite hotels like this solve the problem nicely. But our two bedroom suite here had just the one bathroom, so much as we enjoyed having the sitting room to relax in together, two separate rooms in a conventional hotel suited us better. Of course, Le Square Phillips delivers a great deal pricewise and the terrific location scores every time. Our suite was adequately furnished for our needs and was so large, we could have held a party! It was a quiet corner location and was cool and airy in the hot Montreal summer. It was clean and well serviced, too. Le Square Phillips is a busy hotel with families and groups of friends and the lobby is a bustling place at all times of the day - great for people watching! The elevators are in constant use and patience is sometimes needed. That patience comes in handy at breakfast time too, when timing is crucial. Ten minutes either way can make the difference between a noisy horde and a peaceful experience, though the staff work hard to keep everything running smoothly. Breakfast is basic but adequate and supplies are replenished frequently by the attentive staff. We didn't use the sundeck but witnessed plenty of people on their way to or from the pool and imagine it was a popular place on a summer afternoon. In all, we were pleased with our choice, though the lack of a second bathroom was a major disappointment (we simply didn't look closely enough at the room plans online before booking - our fault). The single bathroom could be a factor to consider before booking a large suite for a group of friends - there could be quite a queue at times!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller56
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Le Square Phillips Hotel and it exceeded our expectations. It was a lovely modern smaller hotel in a very nice, quiet, location in central Montreal. Our room was exceptionally large and beautifully fitted-out with a full kitchen - basically a full studio apartment. Reception staff were very friendly and efficient. The hotel has an excellent business centre with free internet access and printers, etc. No complaints at all. Excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a good hotel especially for a family”
Reviews.Author: blenheim72
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in this hotel which is only a short walk from the main VIA rail station. The location is right in the centre of Montreal with everything (including the old town) readily accessible. The hotel is presumably a converted office building and our room was very large, well equipped (including a full kitchen) but rather spartan in its decoration. This is not a particularly charming hotel but would be an excellent choice for a family given the size of the rooms, the ability to cook some meals and the complimentary continental breakfast that is provided. The breakfast is certainly adequate but on a couple of mornings we had to brave quite a melee to actually get the food from the functional cafeteria style breakfast room. In the end we found it best to pick up a selection and take it back to the room. All in all this is definitely a good option for a place to stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, value and concierge”
Reviews.Author: Ferris5
Reviews.Content: Spacious, comfortable rooms, location walkable to underground city, old town and transportation. Knowledgable concierge - something other more expensive hotels do not even have! Great deck overlooking city if you want to bring your own wine and cheese. Breakfast sufficent to get your day started.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor was right”
Reviews.Author: Chacharea
Reviews.Content: This is our first time stayingt at Le Square Phillips. We loved it-more than helpful staff, great beds, spotlessly clean, and an ideal location for shopping. We particularly enjoyed the roof terrace and pool. The continental breakfast was standard to type and it was more than adequate for our needs-if you desire more, go out since there are a lot of reastaurants nearby. It's best feature was that it was QUIET.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Deidre53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Square Phillips for five nights and highly recommend it for its spacious , comfortable rooms, friendly and helpful staff and its excellent location. Our one bedroom suite was huge and complimentary breakfast was a good start to the day. It was also extremely handy to have a laundry facility available in the hotel- washing machines and dryers. The location is excellent being close to major shopping streets and a short walk to the main train station.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room and walking distance to Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Familytravelmaven
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Square Phillips for two nights in June and it was very spacious for our family of five. THe room had a small kitchenette and table with ample room for a rollaway and walking space. We were able to walk to Old Montreal from the hotel and it was very close to restaurants and shopping. They didn't charge much for parking and we used our car easily while visiting the Botanical Gardens. My boys enjoyed swimming in the pool and the concierge was very helpful and informative with details of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in downtown montreal”
Reviews.Author: cp108
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 days in June 2010. The location of the hotel is excellent in downtown Montreal one block from Rue St. Catherine - a trendy shopping street. They have all suites with full kitchen and china and pots and pans. The rooms are spacious and clean. The service is very good and people are very curtious. We drove there by car from Burlington. We took the car in and out every day and sometimes twice a day. The parking was fixed $21 per day. The rooms through Hotels.com were $200 per day and then we extended our stay by 2 days and the hotel rebooked our room at $220 per day. The continental breakfast was good and isincluded in the room rate. We had a very good vacation staying in this hotel and will highly recommend it for your next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Basically OK”
Reviews.Author: travelpossum
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK, but a little underwhelming. Main negative was the romm; one would think that large romm is welcome but this was more of an industrial size warehouse feel, with painted cement walls, definitely not cozy. the added feature of a kitchen and eating area, all in one very large open room with a very tall ceiling felt strange. On the plus side, the staff was very attentive, and the valet parking most convenient. We arrived late in the evening, and this part of town is completely dead at that time, with only a hamburger place open for dinner nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge room, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: MeanMom289
Reviews.Content: We drove here after three nights in Quebec City. This room is HUGE. It is not beautiful, but rather perfectly fine and comfortable. The concierge service is great. The front desk staff were welcoming and efficient. The valet parking is a welcome treat. I am still not all that familiar with Montreal, but so far, everything we have wanted to see has been very accessible from here. The breakfast is just so-so and would be better if they bothered to get a higher quality of baked goods and included some more whole grain options. The hotel is probably better suited to business travelers and does seem more geared for that. The pool and exercise area are lovely, as is the roof deck.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: wil007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located downtown yet it was clean and quite at night. The staff was great. We never got to check out the breakfast room since we slept in and the breakfast time was from 6 to 930, bit too early if you are traveling for leisure or nightlife, but you have a kitchenette to make your own food so it was ok. The rooftop pool and patio area was awesome and clean. Next time I'm in Montreal that's the place I'll stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Philly413
Reviews.Content: We were so glad that we chose to stay here for the long weekend. It's right in the middle of downtown. The Metro is just across the street and there is a BIXI bike kiosk right in the square. The rooms are great. We had a 1 bedroom suite and it was very spacious with lots of windows and nice high ceilings, the air conditioning worked great, the kitchens are well equipped and everything seems very new and extremely clean, nice flat screen TV's and free high speed internet. The staff are very welcoming and helpful and always say hello each time you walk through the lobby. Breakfast is included and is more than adequate with cereals, juice, yogurt, fruit, waffles and a good variety of breads, pastries and muffins. You can eat in the breakfast area or take it back to your room. There is a small enclose pool on the roof and a terrace that overlooks the square. As the purpose of our trip was to move my son to Montreal we look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room - but could have handled water problems better”
Reviews.Author: ysuindy
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent three nights here at the end of March as part of a four city, week long trip. This was our longest stay. The key word here is spacious. The rooms are very large. Two large beds, a full kitchen including a four person dining room table. Beds are comfortable, pillows adequate. We got good sleep here. Lots of electrical outlets, lot of places to store things. Ample counter space in the bathroom. The bathroom mirror did not fog up while taking a shower. Shower head was high and had good water pressure. Our only issue here involved the water issues. We were not told of the water issues when we checked in. We found a letter in our room telling us that the water would be turned off at 9:00 a.m. the next morning. While not ideal, at least we had warning, although i believe we should have been told of the issue and given the opportunity to find alternative accomodations. When we returned that night we were told the water did come back around 9 p.m. and that the project was complete and there would be no water. I went to the breakfast room around 8:45 the next morning while my son slept. When I came out of the breakfast room at 9:05 there was a sign by the elevator that the water was being turned off at 9:00 a.m. My son was unable to get a shower that day. A staff member later mentioned that the water problems had been ongoing for several days - again information that should have been provided. When I mentioned to the staff that my son was not able to take a shower because of the lack of notice, the reply was "its not our fault." No alternative, no offers (no offer of bottled water either). In fact, while the room was cleaned while we were out, the cleaning staff flushed the empty toilet, removing all the water from the tank. We had hoped to save this tank if necessary. As my son was feeling sick to the stomach that day, we had to leavae the hotel for to use restroom facilities. While I understand the hotel cannot control a water main break, they needed to be upfront with it and have contingency plans, especially if this was a multiple day incident. I didn't ask for a discount - although one should have been offerred. Would i stay here again - probably.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is amazing, the staff the rooms, the convience....”
Reviews.Author: louiemiss
Reviews.Content: We spent Easter week March 30-April 4, at this hotel and purposely added a day to our stay because of the location and facilities. Yes, we were there when there was no water however the hotel did supply bottled water for the guests. A slight inconvience, however we were there to enjoy Montreal not spend it in the room. This was our second visit (last July being our first) to have the concierge remember us was a compliment. At first I was hesitant to pay for valet parking however hearing and experiencing auto theft in the area I felt it was well worth the money. The breakfasts are basic continental, but always plentiful with enough choices. As we were travelling with elite swimmers they were satisfied with the fruits, cereals, toast, breads. with yoghurt. We absolutely love the rooms, we had a variety of choices to view. Our most recent was the one bedroom studio which allows you to have a king bedroom closed door, and a queen size bed with a partial divider. The kitchens come complete with the daily appliances and in our case enough for 6 people. The floor space allows for plenty of movement and no crowding. The indoor roof top pool with the outdoor patio is an added feature. It is a small lap pool but it seemed to satisfy the guest that were there during our stay. As it was a beautiful weekend the patio was comfortably occupied. The hotel itself is spotless, the staff are extremely friendly and very helpful. For anyone travelling in Montreal and area it can be very overwhelming, that being said the staff went out of there way to assist you with maps, directions and suggestions. I actually over heard one of the staff trying to help a guest get hockey tickets. I hope that anyone planning on visiting Montreal and wants to feel at home but be treated like a real guest try this hotel. In the future we will definately revisit this hotel. Once home I acutally missed it.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay - despite the broken water main”
Reviews.Author: frankinto
Reviews.Content: The Square Phillips has been my hotel of choice in Montreal for several years. It is not a full service hotel (Zia Restaurant downstairs delivers and they have good food, but it is not part of the hotel), but it is extremely clean, the rooms are very large and comfortable with lots of storage, there is a full kitchen and the location is perfect. Sometimes things happen that are out of the management's control, such as a broken water main, and we did not have water for a few hours. However, unlike the other reviewer who mentioned this problem, I believe one has to be reasonable. It was a municipal problem and the management was obviously unable to do anything about this, and you can either make demands or take the problem in stride, as we did. This is why I give the hotel five stars even though I was inconvenienced - because I wasn't inconvenienced by *them*.

Reviews.Title: “Is having no water a problem?”
Reviews.Author: theaestheticone
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on the Trip Advisor comments, and in fairness, the reviews are factual. In our case, the water main in the street directly in front of the hotel ruptured not once but twice, forcing the hotel to shut down their water main twice, for 2 12 hour periods of time. The make of a good hotel is not what they do when everything is working, but what they do pro-actively when there is a serious issue. As a guest in a developed country, one would image that having water to drink, shower, wash hands, and flush the toilet are standard expectations. When one does not have this, one immediately expects the management of the hotel to take the challenge as an opportunity to convince their guests to stay with them. This management team failed miserably in seeing any opportunity. Instead, they waited for me to complain and ask about their plan. They had none. I did manage to negotiate a lesser rate after a tense 5 minute discussion. While the hotel had nothing to do with the water main break, only this hotel was effected, leaving all other hotels with water and guests tempting lodging alternatives. We ended up staying only because the water issue was repaired by the time we had returned from a full day of touring. Had the water not been available, we would have left and probably to the W down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: SnailspaceToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a long weekend from Toronto - the reviews on this site swayed us to Square Phillips Hotel over several others, and we didn't regret it. We had a huge king suite on the 10th floor (we were upgraded I guess, because my on-line reservation confirmation indicated Queen, and no mention of a suite! ) with full kitchen, dining area, living area, and separate enormous bedroom - the king size bed honestly looked small in the space. The rooms are tastefully, simply furnished, quasi-boutique hotel look in muted browns and greys. A few little scratches and cracks in the bathroom tiling can be overlooked - the bubbling water damage just starting around the edge of where the bathtub meets the wallboard, not so much. Other than that, the facilities are clean and well maintained. There was only one robe in the bedroom closet, but a call to the front desk and 5 minutes later another was delivered. The staff were knowledgeable and friendly, never were overbearing, and gave advice on getting around and sights to see close by. Check-in was less than 2 minutes. Free wi-fi for the lap top and the iTouch was dead simple to connect to, and relatively quick too. We came by train so no car to park but there are facilities at what I'd consider a reasonable rate for the downtown. The location is excellent, off Rue Ste Catherines, easy walk to Old Montreal, McGill etc - I would suggest that you need not look further than this hotel for excellent and affordable and spacious accommodation in Montreal. Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “You could not do better”
Reviews.Author: 19flights
Reviews.Content: I would have to recommend Le Square Phillips suites to anyone going to Montreal. We stayed there for 6 days and had a wonderful time. The suites are beautifully appointed and have everything you need. The location is wonderful you are near St Catherines so you can either walk or catch a metro to almost anywhere you need to be, The staff were very helpful and if they did not have the answer to your question went and found out the information for you.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, unpretentious, is what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: PetitEdmundo
Reviews.Content: We liked everything about this place, staying there twice, for a total of 8-nights on our recent trip to Quebec. From friendly and helpful staff, to the premier location, terrific room size and comfort i couldn't fault this place. Liked the little extras like free in-room wi-fi, which I've noticed you increasingly have to pay for elsewher. Yes the breakfasts could be more varied, but the nice bright breakfasting room, complete with newspapers kind of made up for it. Being just off Rue Sainte Catherine's, there are plenty of places you can go for a cooked breakfast once you get fed up of the toast and muffins; our favourite being Nickel's just 5 minutes away. Will definitely make this our default home whenever in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Juantoronto
Reviews.Content: I agree wholeheartedly with previous reviews the hotel is excellent and great value for the money. The rooms are apart-hotel type with a kitchen included and very, very spacious, the staff is friendly and helpful, flat TV modern decor and clean, very clean. I slept so well that my wife was surprised. The beds and pillows helped a great deal. They have a small gym and pool on the roof and where you can see old Montreal in its glory. Close to shops and food. Noticeable a soup place near the hotel, yummy!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: rastagrrl
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I had high expectations for the hotel and it lived up to them and more. My kids (4 and 7) upon arrival were immediately charmed by the bellhop guys who high-fived my youngest and talked hockey with my oldest. Really nice to take time like that for little guys. The room was huge and really comfy. A bit too much so, since my husband and I had a hard time getting them outside to see the city. They wanted to go swimming and watch the flat screen tv instead. The pool was really nice for them, and a great vista. However, it's much more of a lap pool. The parking was also convenient. There is a lot right next door and I think it is a bit cheaper. However, it's an outdoor lot and I'm fairly sure there rate of 10 CAD was not for 24 hours like the hotel. Overall, I thought the valet parking charge of 20 CAD was worth it. Overall, the only complaint I heard from our ranks was my husband who claimed the mattress was hard. I however, loved it since I like firmer mattresses. Also, map quest the hotel before you set out for it. The directions included on their website are really, really poor. Luckily we had our iphones and a basic understanding of the Montreal streets or we would have been horribly lost. Anyways, I highly recommend the hotel and can't wait to go back. Super friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: newlyweds71109
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled here as the second part of our honeymoon trip in Canada. I had never been to Montreal before, so it was a bit hard for me to find (although that just might be my lack of city driving skills!)... However, once we found it, we were very pleased! This hotel is located right in the middle of the city, adjacent to Rue St. Catherine! The hotel does charge $20.00 a day for valet parking, but it's an amenity we didn't mind paying for. The concierge/valet service was extremely helpful and even offered to retrieve umbrellas from our car for us on a rainy day. The staff was extremely pleasant and courteous. Because we were on our honeymoon, we were informed that we had been upgraded to a larger room when we checked in. When we entered the room, we were totally blown away. This room was so huge, we didn't know what to do with ourselves!! The pictures online do it no justice, as our ceilings were easily 20 ft. tall, with a separate bedroom area, living area, and kitchen area. It was nicely neat and clean. We were located in the middle of downtown, where everything was just a walk away. Old Montreal was about a 20 minute walk, but this city is really pedestrian friendly. The concierge was really helpful with suggestions for dining out, and recommended some wonderful restaurants. There was complementary continental breakfast served each morning, and a small restaurant attached to the hotel. We didn't eat there, but we wish we had, as it looked good. The best part of the hotel is the roof deck with its amazing view of the city. There are lounge chairs and an indoor swimming pool on the roof. The scenery is incredible in that part of the hotel, and we were frequent visitors. In all, we had a very positive experience here. It was a very classic hotel with many strong points. We certainly recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “great location, in addition to a charming little italian restaurant”
Reviews.Author: sweetCar0line
Reviews.Content: this really made our trip pleasurable and comfortable! the hotel's cleanliness and spacious rooms, in addition to the very professional staff, are only outshone by the good location in downtown Montreal as well as the lovely Italian restaurant where we took our lunch and cappucino. great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our entire trip”
Reviews.Author: chapja
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Montreal for 2 nights as part of a 5 week Canada and USA trip. This hotel was a highlight - well located within easy walking distance of the train station and the main shopping strip, yet in a quiet and safe neighbourhood. The room was huge, with a full kitchen/dishwasher and dining table, and the king sized bed was amazingly comfortable. The hotel has a guest laundry and indoor pool on the top floor, and a no charge business centre for internet/computer access. Everything that a traveller needs. Reception staff were efficient and professional and there was no issue with us conversing in English. The only suggestion that I would make to the hotel is to improve the information contained within the guest services directory - there was no mention of the guest laundry, which we found quite by accident as we were exploring the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Misha22
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Le Square Phillips and were very pleased with our choice. We booked a standard king suite through hotels.com for approximately $150/night. Given the location in a major metropolitan city, we felt we received an excellent value. As others have written, the rooms are huge. Spacious living area with very tall ceilings, a table with 4 chairs, a fully functional kitchen with full-size refrigerator and oven. The bathroom was adequate if on the older side. The bed was fine but firm, which we like but beware if firm mattresses don't agree with you. The bedding could have been of higher quality (you could nearly see through the sheets). Quiet stay and no issues with maid service. The hotel provides a complimentary breakfast which is on par with most complimentary hotel breakfasts. Plenty of cereal and pastry selections, fruit, yogurt, juice & coffee. We loved the size of the room and the location in Montreal. We walked everywhere or took the Metro. Would definitely stay here again if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BenRen
Reviews.Content: Le Square Phillips is an excellent hotel. The location is ideal; it is centrally located and near several Metro stops. Our room was great; the kitchen was well-equipped, the view was nice, and the unique architecture of building really stood out in the room design. I would recommend the hotel to families and couples alike. The free internet access on hotel computers and breakfast were added bonuses that a lot of up-scale hotels don't include in their offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: OzTravellerBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in a double studio room. Hotel is just minutes from busy Rue Catherine but very quiet. Additionally, the hotel is also a short walk to Chinatown, Old Montreal and Metro lines. The room was just as the picture showed on their web page and had a spacious area where the dining table/kitchen was located. The bathroom was large and very clean. The continental breakfast options (included in the hotel rate) were okay but we chose to buy a selection of items at the markets (see my reviews of the Jean Talon and Atwater markets) on a couple of the days instead of the hotel provided breakfast. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalibuMike
Reviews.Content: Located downtown, about a 20 minute walk to Old Town but close to many other attractions this is a smaller hotel with really big, comfortable rooms. Valet parking is $20 a day. Staff was cordial and helpful. Continental breakfast was included but that is my only minor complaint. Very basic, Motel 6-type spread.

Reviews.Title: “great deal on a conveniently located hotel, friendly staff, clean pack n play crib”
Reviews.Author: VATravelFans
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a 5-day vacation in August 2009. Had a nice problem-free stay in a large room (for no particular reason, we were upgraded to a larger suite than we booked). Fully equipped kitchen was nice- housekeeping did our dishes even though I think that was our responsibility. Room was nice and spacious but not fancy. Plenty of closet space. Clean Pack N Play crib was available for our one-year-old (although no one brought sheets). Hotel was quiet, staff were extremely friendly and helpful with suggestions for restaurants, etc. Pizza place Il Focolaio a couple doors down was really good and had outdoor seating. French restaurant a block away Restaurant Julien was good but pricier. Rooftop pool and deck were small but nice to have. Valet parking was $20 per day. Free internet worked fine (have to ask for a password at the front desk). Free breakfast included the usual fare- sometimes we skipped it. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience in 10 years”
Reviews.Author: didywadidy
Reviews.Content: most overrated hotel. made a reservation based on trip advisor rating bnut TA way off on this one. arrogant check in staff, cold impersonal room, internet connection terrible, coffee and breakfast must be avoided. Room was large but so what. i had to empty the dishwasher when i checked in to get a cup for coffee. The gym is useless. Montreal is a great city. this hotel is like a plain vanilla hotel in any city. no feeling at all that one is in such a great city. I would never stay here again. do yourself a favor and find another hotel to stay in Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Largest room ever”
Reviews.Author: Cork
Reviews.Content: Our Junior Suite 411 at the Square Phillips was the largest room I ever have experienced in my 25+ years of travelling around the globe. I took 19 large steps from the kitchen end to the window end and almost 6 steps the narrow side, This included bedroom, living room and kitchen. Partitions separated them somewhat. Additionally comes a long isle opening to a medium sized bathroom with missing decor and a walk in closet. Overall easily more than 100 square meters. Amazing! Obviously they had some space left when transforming the office building into a hotel. Location was good, though you needed ground transportation to go to the trendy latin quarter. Staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel was quiet though we had some loud neighbors baging doors Sunday early morning. Just one question: Who needs 2 oversized flat screen TVs in listening distance? WiFi worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: martylup
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a Friday and Saturday in late August as part of a trip to Montreal & Quebec City. Great Value. Good location, easy-in easy out with Valet Parking. Its within walking distance of shopping old Montreal & Chinatown (although a bit far for the later two). We had a large roon with a full kitchen complete with refrigerator, microwave, table plates and utensils. Breakfast was included but is limited but adequate(cereal, bagels, peanut butter, bread, muffins and fruit). Would certainly recommned for families and for longer satys.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: detoxed
Reviews.Content: The location in downtown Montreal cannot be beaten - ideal for shopping, cultural activities, visits to museums and old Montreal. The rooms are certainly large with confortable beds, although the decor and bathrooms appear somewhat dated. Free internet access if provided to those with their own computer - otherwise at the business centre on the first floor. Breakfast is served until 0930 and the breakfast room gets overcrowded with families vying for tables and squeezing past each other to get to the food - which is basic fare. Check in staff were OK but did not bother to explain the hotel's facilities. The biggest pain was the housekeeping staff - they will even enter the room while you are at breakfast and before you are even ready for the day ahead, or they will call you on the phone to ask when you are leaving. However, their activities did not seem to stretch to changing the bed linen - during a week long stay, this did not happen once.

Reviews.Title: “Great for teens”
Reviews.Author: SJ46
Reviews.Content: Great location. Big rooms which our two teenagers liked. Excellent service and very secure. Two Internet terminals in business centre at lobby level. Breakfast could be better if there were more choices. Small gym and beautiful swimming pool on top level. Also a nice deck on roof. Central to downtown Montreal. Beds are very firm but we were ok with them. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great set up all-around”
Reviews.Author: familyoffiveNewYork
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in a two bedroom suite - incredibly spacious. The hotel is very centrally located so you can walk in many different directions. The included breakfast is very simple but it is quick and easy and filling. It is very nice not to have to look for another restaurant for a meal. The pool is small but very nice with a nice roof-top deck. The hotel is very quiet. I was always surprised at how many people were in the breakfast room given that we didn't hear or see them at any other time of day. We will definitely go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely---Perfect for our little family.”
Reviews.Author: gillda
Reviews.Content: Most have already covered what we would say. It would be nice to see a bit more variety in the breakfast, but that is our only small quibble. It is so comfortable, and the service was fabulous--they were lovely and classy, and not at all pretentious. The pizza place a few doors down had good thin-crust pizza--you can take it back to your room or eat on the patio area there, so it's really convenient. The hotel downstairs was nice, but a bit pricier/nicer than necessary for a family with an impatient small child. They were very accommodating, but it was kinda wasted on her 4-year-old sensibilities.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the planet”
Reviews.Author: johnwardale
Reviews.Content: HUGE, HUGE room with FULL FRIDGE, MicroWave, 4-burner stove and *EVERYTHING*, very reasonable prices (for Montreal), totally awesome staff! They are large enuf to be very professional, and They are SMALL enuf to be very PERSONAL, and to remember you, your car, etc. etc. Great view from the 11th floor pool balcony! Very close to underground shopping, ... everything you could want is in walking distance 4 blocks to IGA, 5 blocks to Palace de Congress ... 1 or 2 or 3 blocks to *AWESOME* food ... Easy walk to "Old Town" where the hotel prices are 1.5x to 2x more. Parking is *INDOOR* and the Valet/Concierge is *VERY* *FAST*!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: micer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Montreal for our anniversary and wanted to be in a fairly central location with access to public transportation. We found the Le Square Phillips to be excellent for our purposes. We also enjoyed our late afternoon time on the rooftop deck to relax with some wine. The rooms were spacious and clean with a kitchen. The breakfasts were adequate. Although we weren't able to get much direction from the concierge, we had done homework before hand so it wasn't a big deal. If you are looking for extreme luxury, the Le Square Phillips is probably not for you. However, if you are looking for comfortable, centrally located with access to public transportation, and an inviting spot to watch the city go by, this is the place. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, perfect for a short or in my case 7 week stay”
Reviews.Author: only1kadee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of downtown montreal. It is very close to loads of restaurants, st Catherine st full of shopping and walking distance to the port, old montreal, mont royal, latin quarter etc. It is also a very short walk to the metro to go to other places. The hotel staff are helpful but not obstrusive which is what I like so perfect for our family. The rooms are huge and come with a fully equipped kitchen, massive bathroom by hotel standards and daily room service. Valet parking is also available. Concierges are very helpful if you ask and there is a great Italian restaurant colocated but not part of the hotel. The rates are very good for such a location and size of room. There is a small but adequately equipped gym, infact, in 7 weeks not once did we have to wait to use the equipment. There is a coin operated laundry and roof top pool and terrace. Continental breakfast is included and while adequate choice is provided the room set up is not ideal, we avoided the place on the weekends as it was very crowded, during the week is fine but you have a tray in your room and can go grab what you want and then toast away in your room. There is free wireless internet also which we took advantage of and a business centre where you can print if you need too. Given we were there in the summer we could hear the music festivals (jazz and francofolies) from the roof top or walk easily to the shows. All up we recommend this place for short or long stay and especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect again!”
Reviews.Author: princesskimmy
Reviews.Content: Arrived late, and no problem. Staff friendly as usual. Got great opinions on places to visit. Never a miss with this hotel. The studio room was so large, we had no complaints. Every appliance is so clean, it is just a nice feeling to be in a clean atmosphere away from home. All-in-all, you can't want more for your money. Again, the complimentary breakfast was a very nice touch. Right downtown in the mix. The Bay is at the end of the block for great shopping. Movie house about five minutes away, and the amtrak station is within a fifteen min walking distance. Let this hotel be your base for a pleasant stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Short Stay, Fantastic for a Long One”
Reviews.Author: FrenchBroadCabin
Reviews.Content: I spent a month on business in the Square Phillips along with my wife. We had a junior suite which was, to put it mildly, spacious. The kitchen was well equipped with real appliances, the bathroom was huge and the other spaces were, well, roomy. There is closet space galore. Very comfy for a long stay. The location is central. It is a short walk to the Central RR Station and very close to the Metro and the underground city (important in Winter). Many major Montreal corporate HQs and business locations are within a short walk. Breakfast is included, although it is a somewhat minimal continental (toast, croissants, bagels) with cereal and yogurt and fruit. Nonetheless, the items available were good. We supplemented with our own berries and other things bought in a nearby supermarket. Many restaurants serving a full breakfast are nearby. There is an Italian restaurant in the building (not really part of the hotel, although you can order room service). It was good, although we found it a tad pricey. There are many, many other restaurants of all types in the immediate neighborhood. High speed Internet is available via a hard-wired plug and Wifi. It works well, although it slows down noticeably in the evening when many other users are on. The staff were great, cooperative and helpful. The only negative - the windows don't open! No problem most of the year, but a bit frustrating on a nice spring day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, overpriced, make sure it is right location for your visit.”
Reviews.Author: 68amx
Reviews.Content: Without doubt, this is a lovely hotel: very modern, chic, and twenty-first century. The room is HUGE; this is the only time I might complain about the room being too big. In my opinion, the hotel is overpriced at approximately $200 (US) per night. If your aim is to be near the St. Catherine Street shopping area, the location is perfect. If, however, you desire to be spend your time in Old Montreal, near the docks, or at Cirque de Soleil, it is quite a hike from Le Square Phillips Hotel. Concierge service lackluster. For our purposes, our stay in the Holiday Inn Express in Chinatown was far better. The property does not meet the standard of Le Square Phillip, but the location is great (a couple of blocks from Notre Dame Basilica) and forty percent cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Asst_Fire_Chief
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in July '09. Good location right in downtown and convenient to old town and china town. The rooms were clean and adequate, although not spectacular. Having a kitchen is nice, and there's a grocery store 4 blocks from hotel. The hotel has a clinical feel to it however, it's not warm nor inviting, Some of the staff were really friendly, others were actually rude. Parking is always a hassle and except late at night there's always a line of double-parked cars in front of the place. I won't return, my feeling is that for the money there must be better places to stay in Montreal and I can't imagine how it gets such a high rating on here. Also, the pool is really just a lap pool, 4 feet deep at all places and perhaps 10 X 20 in area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: QQ1234
Reviews.Content: The other reviews are accurate -- what can we add: really huge rooms, huge bathroom, excellent service staff (and friendly and very knowledgeable about Montreal).
